column2: A career in our Microsoft Dynamics team will provide the opportunity to help our clients transform their technology landscape across Front, Back and Mid-Office functions leveraging Microsoft Dynamics      We focus on contributing to PwC s value proposition of strategy led and technology enabled , by aligning our Consulting Solutions industry focus with the Microsoft technologies such as Dynamics 365, Azure, Power Platform and Power BI                  Job Description:            D365 f&O Technical Consultant/Senior Consultant - PwC        PwC is the leading global professional services firm and is acclaimed as one of the world's leading employers. PwC offers a rich experience in terms of the variety of projects it delivers, the caliber of its individuals, and the exceptional training and career development opportunities it provides for its people.      To develop our Microsoft capability at PwC, we are looking for people who enjoy the excitement of shaping new ideas and working as part of multi-disciplinary teams on complex challenges, where each project is likely to be different to the last.      We are looking for candidates with the passion and commitment, intellect and experience that can enable our clients success in the intensely competitive economic environment of the digital age.      Our unique strength at PwC is our ability to operate as one firm across multiple disciplines.      As well as providing Microsoft and consulting capabilities, we also bring the full range of our economics, assurance, risk, tax, deals, and corporate finance capabilities to bear on the real world problems our clients face.      Within consulting, we combine deep insight, functional expertise, powerful tools and practical experience, to deliver measurable, positive outcomes for our clients.      At PwC, we strive to become trusted advisers to our clients, delivering results that help them unleash their potential.      We are looking for candidates with the intellect, passion, commitment and desire to help our clients succeed in the intensely competitive economic environment.      The successful individuals will work with senior team members, to develop strategies and approaches to help our clients manage through periods of large scale change and equip them with the relevant skills to manage the impact associated with their Microsoft projects.      They will have the skills and experience to coach clients and teams to create alignment and advice on technical, process, cultural and behavioral change.          Competency / Capability / Experiences Skills          Ability to design solutions      Ability to estimate work packets/Projects      Delivered 3-4 large implementations or equivalent      Ability to lead a team      Uses creative ways to find solutions      Good verbal & written communication skills      Able to identify performance bottlenecks and fix it      Is certified on latest product at desired levels      Great Team Player      Ability to translate customer requirements in to solution design      Proficient in Delivery methodology (SureStep Preferable)                3 to 8 years of Work experience in IT Industry      D365 f&O/AX 2012 -R2/R3      Good knowledge of LCS, DevOps      Object Oriented Programming and Design      experience      Morph X / X++      Good understanding of AX entity & Object      model      Should be able to do estimations of AX      Customizations, Testing etc      SQL Programming and Query Tuning      SSRS Reporting      AIF, Workflows etc      Can plan and organize delivery of solution          Qualification:    BE/BTECH/MCA/BSC or equivalent        Travel requirements    Yes Job requires travel        Roles and Responsibilities        Develop in Dynamics AX to customize the product and reports as per the users business requirements      Set up the IT infrastructure and DBMS (database management system) required for Dynamics AX      Implement data migration and integration using Dynamics AX tools      Provide technical expertise for the Dynamics AX and Microsoft development technologies and environments.      Follow development best practices and document required technical artifacts related to the project      Work with AX functional team and client IT team for a common goal of a successful implementation      Should be able to work in a team environment and contribute towards      Practice/Project/Organization goals                Mandatory Skills: D365 Technical/F&O Technical    Qualifications: BE/B.tech

column2: We are looking for an individual ideally with knowledge and experience of Environmental Site Assessments and Investigation, chemical assessment and quantitative risk assessment relating to land contamination, waste and brownfield regeneration, to join our reputable Environment team and support an expanding project workload and client base.             ?         Mandatory Requirements           3-6 years experience in conducting Phase I Site Assessment and Phase 2 intrusive Site Investigation, with experience in multiple site investigation techniques.     Post Graduate Degree qualified in a relevant engineering or science subject (e.g. geology, geosciences, chemistry, environmental science and hydrogeology).     Demonstrate good, relevant land    contamination/brownfield    land experience in Phase 1 Desk Studies.     Knowledge and technical understanding of conceptual site models and generic level risk assessments for soils and waters. Experience working for global regions will be preferable either in an excellence center or in the region.     Proficient ability to interpret, review and analyze large and complex soil data.     Experience of producing well written factual and interpretative reports.     Good communication and presentation skills.     Understanding of Indian environmental regulations.     Ability to take initiative and work independently or within a team   .       Willingness to learn and adapt to the project/team/wider team   .             Desirable Requirements:           Knowledge / experience in soil waste management/waste handling/waste remediation is an advantage.     Field work experience would be an advance but not essential.     Knowledge and technical understanding of conceptual site models and generic level risk assessments for controlled waters (in the UK, surface water and groundwater) and human health risk assessments (CLEA tool) and using Soil Guideline Values (Environment Agency, UK).     Industry standards CIRIA, 2001. Contaminated land risk assessment. A guide to good practice (C552), and have broad understanding of DEFRA, 2012. Environmental Protection Act 1990: Part 2A, Contaminated Land Statutory Guidance.     CL:AIRE and CIRIA guidance for Asbestos, Petroleum Hydrocarbons in Groundwater and C4SLs.     Codes of practice for ground investigations and potentially contaminated sites.     Knowledge of groundwater modelling software ConSim/P20 would be an advantage   .             Rewards and Benefits           Competitive in the industry.           Primary Responsibilities           Work primarily with soils materials and waste specialists in the UK to undertake project specific waste classification requirements.     Training to undertake waste classification and gain better understanding of the tasks and tools involved. Training will be provided as part of the role.     Originate waste classification tasks, including reporting and deliverables related prior to issuing for check and review.     Originate material management and permitting requirements and technical documents that may be required as part of the project.     Scheduling and managing work to acceptable quality, on time and to budget.           Other Responsibilities           Organisation, collation, and assessment of desk-based information as part of Phase 1 Desk Studies.     Assisting in designing or able to design (then organise)    environmental/geo-environmental    site investigations, including soil sampling and ground    gas/vapour/leachate/groundwater    and surface water monitoring/sampling.     Preparing Method Statements, Specifications and Drawings.     Digital Data Management and sample scheduling, data transfer and statistics.     Factual and Interpretative Reporting.     Scheduling and managing work to acceptable quality, on time and to budget.     Developing own competence with support from the business on own training and development needs.
column11: Material management, Waste management, Environmental science, Data management, Risk assessment, Scheduling, Training and Development, Resource management, Petroleum, Monitoring

column2: As a Bain Associate Consultant, your analytical, inter-personal, creative thinking, business management and leadership skills will be called upon from day one. You will begin as a generalist and be in the thick of the action as you work side-by-side with some of the best in the business. Every day is different but a sample of the things you can expect to accomplish are:       Providing clients with powerful facts and analyses that outline solutions and drive change     Work on case teams in roles that vary according to the team s objective     Be responsible for identifying information sources, gathering, and interpreting data, and presenting their findings to case team members     Interviewing the client s customers, competitors, suppliers, and employers; this work becomes the basis of the case team s strategic recommendation       The learning curve is steep, but from over 50 years of experience, we know that you will be able to handle it. And the rewards - global travel, influential connections, world-class training, personal satisfaction, unparalleled career development and, yes, financial - are second to none. column2: WJCF will support Haryana in driving adoption of ABDM in the private sector, as the Development Partner under the NHA s 100 Microsites initiative       Our primary responsibilities include building capacity of the field staff deployed by the Interfacing Agency and supporting the State ABDM Office in monitoring progress and reporting to the NHA     Apart from the three key stakeholders (State ABDM Office, Interfacing Agency and the NHA), we will also work closely and collaboratively with multiple stakeholders, including state-and-district level authorities, statutory bodies such as medical commissions, professional associations, and of course, the healthcare professionals themselves       WJCF is looking to hire an Associate to work in close collaboration with the Haryana State ABDM Office in Panchkula and support the Interfacing Agencies working for the implementation of microsites to help drive adoption of ABDM among healthcare professionals in the state     A particular focus of this role is to support the State ABDM Office in widening their engagement with healthcare professionals by leveraging various existing platforms such as medical conferences, digital health events, and such others and deepen the engagement with the healthcare professionals through implementation of microsites                    The microsite approach to adoption is important for the ABDM ecosystem in two main ways:             By engaging deeply with an ecosystem of providers, it helps catalyse demand for ABDM through a flywheel effect - demonstrating the value of ABDM to all stakeholders, thereby jump-starting wider demand-based adoption.         As sites for learning and experimentation, microsites deepen the ABDM ecosystem s understanding of attitudes, incentives and circumstances that can drive or hinder adoption of ABDM, thereby helping to identify new use cases and sharpen its value proposition.                   This role provides an opportunity to be at the heart of and directly influence the nascent and fast-moving digital health journey in India. While based out of the State ABDM Office in Panchkula, the successful candidate will work closely with an Analyst who is also based in Panchkula and our ABDM Adoption team based out of the NHA.           Primary responsibilities will include:                 Build a working relationship with the State ABDM Office (SAO), Haryana          Proactively identify area(s) of support including but not limited to (i) Capacity building, (ii) IEC deployment in the state to drive ABDM adoption         Building key stakeholder relationship(s) with (i) ABDM-enabled IT solution providers, (ii) Medical Associations and Councils, (iii) State ABDM office, and other(s) as required         Building useful tools and checklists for the interfacing agency to optimise the interfacing agency s field team outreach (e.g., visit planner, visit checklists, FAQs, reporting forms, etc.)          Monitor the progress of the microsite(s) implemented in Haryana and support the State ABDM office in documenting the learnings and reporting progress to National Health Authority         Regular problem solving and coaching the Analyst and interfacing agency in the state         Identification, on-boarding and collaboration with ABDM-enabled IT solution providers          Supporting SAO to identify and participate in medical conferences, workshops, and CME sessions to convey benefits of becoming a part of the ABDM ecosystem         Engaging professional bodies and associations of healthcare professionals to leverage their existing communication channels (sessions, newsletters, magazines, blogposts, and such others) for spreading awareness about ABDM among their members         Exploring other innovative ways to reach out and engage healthcare professionals to enable them to participate in India s digital health journey         Strengthening the capacity of the SAO by supporting them in on boarding a Program Management Unit (PMU) for ABDM implementation in the state             Required                       Masters/Bachelors degree in management, public health, engineering, digital health, public policy, or similar fields.         Work experience of 5+ years in digital health, management consulting, public health, public policy, or allied areas.         Proven performance in a fast-paced, results driven environment.                 Preferred             Experience working in a multi-stakeholder environment and / or government stakeholder management experience would be a strong positive.         Experience in e-governance or digital health programs in India.                  Skills & Traits:                 Required             Excellent analytical (qualitative and quantitative) skills and communication (written and verbal) skills.         High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, PowerPoint and Word.         Willingness to travel across states, as required (up to 40% travel).         Ability to think strategically, handle ambiguity, and problem solve in a fast-paced, limited-structure, multicultural environment.         Impeccable integrity.         Humility and open-mindedness.         Learning mentality.         Tenacity and resourcefulness.         Willingness to speak up, and then to commit once a decision is taken.         Fluency in English.              Preferred             Ability to navigate complex processes and influence decision-making in a professional and collaborative manner.         Fluency in Hindi and additional Indian language

column2: Who We Are At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward ??always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities. The Role Unleash your expertise and embark on a thrilling journey with Kyndryl Consult, the professional services arm of Kyndryl. We are seeking an exceptional and visionary Consult Associate Partner (AP), Consult Partner (P) and Consult Senior Partner (SP) on a global scale, individuals who possess the power to transform customer IT outcomes and revolutionize businesses. As a Consult AP/P/SP, you will be at the forefront of driving digital transformation, mitigating risks, and achieving operational excellence, all while solving the most critical challenges faced by our customers.  At Kyndryl, we believe in harnessing the full potential of our mission-critical global strength, combined with the cutting-edge technology capabilities of our Global Practices. From the vast realms of Cloud, Mainframe, Networking and Edge, Data & Application, Security & Resilience, to Digital Workplace, you will have the opportunity to leverage these tools to create a remarkable impact. Joining our high-growth Consult business, you will be an integral part of multi-disciplinary teams, guiding them through complex consulting engagements and responsible for creating and positioning value for Kyndryl's largest accounts and groundbreaking opportunities. Picture yourself immersed in a start-up-like environment, where you will engage with senior leaders both internally and among our esteemed clientele. Kyndryl, as the world's largest provider of mission-critical IT operations and infrastructure services, offers an unrivaled platform for you to thrive. As a Consult AP/P/SP, you will wield immense influence within the customer and Kyndryl account teams, forging senior-level relationships and driving value-based outcomes. Your role will encompass leading small teams of practitioners across multiple projects, nurturing your leadership skills, and propelling your career within one of the fastest-growing IT consulting businesses on a global scale. Are you ready to take the helm, navigate uncharted territories, and leave an indelible mark on the world of digital transformation? Join Kyndryl Consult as a Consult AP/P/SP and embark on an extraordinary adventure where passion meets purpose, and innovation knows no bounds. Your Future at Kyndryl Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career, from Associate Partner to Senior Partner, we have opportunities in all industries and technologies that you won?? find anywhere else. At Kyndryl, we work with clients in a variety of industries and markets, so whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here. However, equally as important ??you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused ??someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you??e open and borderless ??naturally inclusive in how you work with others. column1: Accounts Payable / Receivable Associate or Officer
column2: Accounts Payable and Receivables clerk  Job Description     Job Description: The Accounts Payable Clerk processes revenue, cash/banking information, and accounts payable transactions, administers customer account collections, reconciles and payable control accounts, and generates payments to vendors and payees. This position also makes recommendations for process improvements in and payable. Key Responsibilities: Processes and revenue collection functions, including preparing, printing, and posting invoices, following up on outstanding invoices and administering collection agency contract. Performs transaction processing related to payments, revenue collection and bank deposits. Processes accounts payable invoices and expense claims for payment by matching and verifying with purchase orders, requisitions, packing slips, vendor statements and receipts and entering staff reimbursements into import template. Ensures accounts payable invoices and expense claims are accurate, properly coded and authorized for payment. Performs transaction processing related to accounts payable.                  Generates payments, ensures cheques are authorized according to library policy and distributed to payees. Ensures completeness and accuracy of all and accounts payable databases and files, including monthly, periodic, and annual reconciliation of control accounts. Makes recommendations for continual process improvements and ensures that procedures are documented. Ensures accurate processing to accounts in compliance with appropriate policies and procedures, with correct application of taxes. Responds to enquiries from external and internal customers. Provides month end and year end accounting support, as required. Promotes a safe workplace; ensures that all established safety procedures are followed.  Fosters and maintains positive working relationship with the Director of Finance and Facilities, staff, vendors, customers, the public and external organizations. Performs other related duties as required.       Required Skills and Abilities : ??Experience working in a general bookkeeping or accounting position specifically in the areas of accounts payable. ??Proficiency and experience with spreadsheets (MS Excel) and word processing (MS Word). ??Experience working in a highly computerized environment and processing financial transactions using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.  ??Experience working with large volume of transactions and in complex systems, requiring a high degree of speed, accuracy, and attention to detail.                 ??Knowledge and understanding of sub-ledgers and how they translate to general ledgers.  ??Understanding of the principles of processes and systems, POS systems, cash, taxation, and account collection.  ??Understanding of the principles of accounts payable processes, systems, and taxation.     ??Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal, and customer service skills are required. ??Ability to work independently, set priorities and meet deadlines.              ??Ability to use independent judgment and discretion and organize workloads.          ??Ability to maintain confidentiality.                             ??Ability to adapt, troubleshoot, research solutions, and make recommendations to improve work efficiencies. ??Bachelors degree in commerce, Accounting and Finance, Master of Business Administration, or a related field. ??The ideal candidate should have minimum of 5 ??8 years of experience and used to work in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. ??Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.   Why Us? You will join a fast-growing scale up with a lot of opportunities to develop yourself within the company. You will join a diverse and international team across 3 continents. You will work in a fun and informal environment. We are a flexible and remote friendly company.           About Dynamix   We??e engineers, strategists, business rock stars and puzzle experts. We have over a decade of experience in the telecom and IT industry, producing and designing innovative communication products and IT solutions for companies that are as smart as they are effective.       Dynamix Labs Private Limited CIN # U72200TG2015FTC099730

column2: W      HAT WE LOOK FOR WHILE RECRUITING:              Whether it is a consulting expert, a research analyst, a finance prodigy or an investment banker, we seek to hire the best across the globe and provide them with a unique global ecosystem of learning, experience and expertise. column2: We are looking for world-class talent to join a crack team of engineers, product managers and designers     We want people who are passionate about creating software that makes a difference to the world     We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do     We prize team-first mentality, personal responsibility and tenacity to solve hard problems and meet deadlines     As part of a small and lean team, you will have a very direct impact on the success of the company     We are looking for talented and self-motivated Salesforce Consultants, technical functional             For Technical Salesforce engineers: you will be responsible for:     Salesforce Development and Customization: Develop custom solutions and interfaces on the Salesforce platform using Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and other Salesforce technologies. Customize Salesforce fields, page layouts, record types, workflows, and approval processes.     Systems Integration: Integrate Salesforce with other business systems and applications using various APIs, middleware, and other integration tools.     Data Management and Analytics: Manage data import, data cleansing, deduplication, and data maintenance activities. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key business metrics.     Technical Leadership and Project Management: Lead technical aspects of Salesforce projects, including planning, execution, and delivery. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with business objectives.     User Training and Support: Train end-users on new features and functionalities. Provide ongoing support and troubleshooting for Salesforce users.     Continuous Improvement: Keep abreast of new Salesforce features and functionality, and provide recommendations for process improvements.     Quality Assurance and Documentation: Ensure quality of deliverables through rigorous testing and code review practices. Document system configurations and technical processes.     For Functional Salesforce consultants: you will be responsible for:     Salesforce Configuration and Management: Configure and manage the Salesforce platform, including custom objects, fields, record types, page layouts, workflows, process builders, validation rules, and reports.     Business Requirements Analysis: Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into effective Salesforce solutions. Analyze business processes and recommend Salesforce solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.     User Training and Support: Conduct training sessions for Salesforce end-users and provide ongoing support. Assist users in understanding new features and functionalities.     Data Management: Oversee data quality and integrity in Salesforce. Manage data imports, exports, and data updates. Implement best practices for data management and governance.     Collaboration with Technical Team: Collaborate with technical team members for advanced customizations requiring coding or integrations. Ensure that functional configurations align with the technical architecture.     Testing and Quality Assurance: Perform thorough testing of Salesforce functionalities, including user acceptance testing. Ensure that solutions meet business requirements and are free from defects.     Documentation: Document system configurations, processes, and training materials. Maintain updated documentation for reference and compliance purposes.     Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on new Salesforce features and functionalities. Recommend improvements to enhance system performance and user experience.             Job requirements           For Technical Salesforce Consultants:       Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.     Proven experience as a Salesforce developer with strong knowledge of Salesforce architecture and design.     Proficient in Salesforce development languages and tools (Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, etc).     Experience with Salesforce integrations and API s.     Salesforce certifications (eg, Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I/II) are highly preferred.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.             For Technical Salesforce Consultants:       Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field.     Proven experience in Salesforce administration and configuration.     In-depth understanding of Salesforce CRM and its functional capabilities.     Familiarity with Salesforce automation tools such as Process Builder and Flow.     Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think analytically.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with various stakeholders.     Salesforce Administrator certification is highly preferred.

column1: Hiring For Staff Environment, Social & Governance
column2: Relevant Industry   Climate Change & Sustainability Services Job Description  Responsibilities As part of our EY-Managed Services Team, the Staff will be responsible for working closely with CCaSS (Climate Change and Sustainability) seniors and managers on clients and engagements across global locations to provide end to end ESG Reporting services. The Opportunity The Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Managed Services team is part of the global firm. We are looking for a passionate, high energy, and self-motivated individual who is accustomed to working independently and collaboratively on small and large projects in a close-knit team. The team is at the core of the Firm's strategy, working with industries and practice areas to orchestrate the ESG delivery efforts and solve the most complex challenges in more cohesive, consistent, and exponentially powerful ways. We're looking for an incumbent who is accountable for the timeliness and quality of work performed in accordance with project requirements for our Managed Services team and possess basic ESG reporting knowledge. Your key responsibilities Assist Seniors in data management and analysis for ESG reporting. Use the available guidances on ESG knowledge and frameworks for providing technical support, as and when required. Maintain effective coordination with multiple stakeholders. Assist Seniors / Managers in preparing metrics for ESG Reporting process. Work with global teams under leadership guidance in driving the ESG Reporting managed services engagements. Assist in build the necessary documents like SOPs and other end user training materials. Follow through on client requests in a timely fashion, and manage expectations regarding the timing of deliverables and reports. Develop and maintain strong relationships with global counterparts. Skills and attributes for success Data management and analytics. Should have good communication skills and shall be good at preparing control documents, prepare presentations and shall also be a good presenter. Shall consistently deliver quality services and take charge of the assigned engagement. Should have Knowledge of sustainability and GHG reporting. Knowledge on materiality, double materiality and gap assessment is desirable. Ability to thrive in a complex and fast-paced environment with competing priorities. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Self-motivated, innovative, and strong team player. Demonstrate willingness to learn new solutions, approaches, and methodologies for project delivery. Knowledge of sustainability frameworks such as GRI, TCFD, CSRD, CDP, ISSB, SASB is desirable. Desired profile of the candidate  To qualify for the role, you must have Bachelor?? degree e.g. B.Tech, BSc. BBA Master?? degree e.g. MBA, M.Tech would be a plus 1-3 years relevant experience including experience in ESG reporting, Financial reporting or experience working in corporate strategy. Ideally, you??l also have Proficiency in MS ??Excel, MS ??Office. Understanding of any Data analytics/visualisation tools will be additional advantage. Strong communication, Interpersonal, Analytical Skills & highly proactive in approach.

column2: This experienced position is responsible for the configuration and support of software application systems within the People Organization. As part of the HR Technology team, this role provides moderately complex analytical and consultative support delivering HR processes.          II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities        To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other duties may be assigned.        Monitors HR systems, open cases and reviews current processes to troubleshoot application related issues and answers system related questions. May coordinate with other team members or vendor for resolution.      Develops and maintains a strong working knowledge of assigned application(s) in order to, effectively utilize its capabilities. Seeks development from more experienced team members and from vendor provided user groups, customer sites and training.      Provides input and consultation on requested configuration changes, partnering with the team to determine best options for design decisions based on documented requirements, current configuration and downstream impacts. Documents final specs and configures application      Analyzes impact of configuration of tables, data fields, foundational structures and processes on downstream systems and integrations.      Ensures data integrity and governance by supporting large/complex data imports and extracts and validating accuracy through reporting and queries. Supports the development and maintenance of integrations/file transfers.      Provides analysis on the implementation of new software application products or new modules in existing applications.      Understands more technical objects role in processes (extensions, Fast Formulas, etc.). May support migrations and data imports/extractions and engage Digital and vendor for support      Executes unit, integration and acceptance testing. Working with the functional team, provides screen shots and system steps for testing and change management.      May be responsible for configuring and delivering reports and queries utilizing delivered software. Follows established data governance.      Documents all configuration.            III. Supervisory Responsibilities            No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.      Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance and/or training to coworkers.      May lead project teams and/or plan and supervise assignments of lower level employees.            IV. Qualifications        The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.        A. Education and Experience          Education: Bachelor s Degree (accredited), or in lieu of degree, High School Diploma or GED (accredited) and four (4) years of relevant work experience.      Experience: Five (5) years of previous experience (in addition to education requirement).          B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements          None required.          C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required          Experience with queries/extracts and reports and supporting integrations.      Experience with queries/extracts and reports and supporting integrations.      Hands on configuration of application(s), evaluating impact and supporting releases, patches, upgrades and enhancements.      Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.            V. Work Environment        Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.        Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the work day;      Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than 30 pounds rarely;      Required to be exposed to physical occupational risks (such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, etc.) rarely;      Required to be exposed to physical environment which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements rarely;      Normal setting for this job is: office setting.      Must be available to work standard business hours, as well as be available to work non-standard hours in case of emergency (natural disasters, power outages, etc.). May need to attend after hours calls with the offshore team.

column2: The Senior Analyst, reporting directly to the Senior Program Manager, would be a pivotal part of the project preparation facilities (PPF) team within CPI        This position combines a zest for driving climate impact with analytical prowess and a transaction-oriented approach        The ideal candidate will bring prior experience related to financial analysis, company appraisal and deal closure      Furthermore, a working interest on specific climate-positive sectors, especially renewable energy, will be hugely valuable in this role             Primary Duties & Responsibilities                            Outreach                Anchoring or assisting in market outreach across identified segments and product categories through effective engagement with project developers and enterprises, industry associations like CLEAN and GOGLA, ecosystem enablers, investors/lenders and other stakeholders              Preparing and updating marketing collaterals and presentations, in coordination with Communications team; convening seminars, webinars and workshops for the decentralised renewable industry              Empanelling service providers for various project preparation activities                            Applicant Evaluation                Following up with applicants for ensuring receipt of proposals in the designated format, and ensuring receipt of information              Conducting visits, wherever required, to applicants sites of manufacturing, offices and/or business operations and engaging with discussions with local representatives              Writing appraisal reports/ memos incorporating all the facets of a case, for presenting to the internal screening committee/ Advisory Committee              Convening/assisting in convening the committee meetings, participating in discussions and fielding case-related questions, and announcing awardees publicly on the website                            Transaction Advisory/Contract Management                Finalising scope of work for service providers with awardees, and list and schedule of deliverables              Engaging with the awardees over the process of selecting service providers, which could include their floating request for proposals (RFPs) and bid processing as per CPI templates              Managing contracts, monitoring submission of deliverables by selected service providers and interacting with Finance/ Accounts for grant disbursement              Participating in discussions on deals with potential investors/lenders, wherever required, along with or behalf of the grant awardee; structuring and closing term sheets              Coordinating with beneficiaries on their impact self-reporting initiatives, collating individual reports for overall program reporting to funder as per pre-determined KPIs for CPI; coordinating with the funders Monitoring, Learning & Evaluation (MLE) team and their designated agencies for funders impact assessments, wherever required.                            Other roles                Writing concept notes and thematic reports on various aspects of climate/climate finance like DRE, climate-smart agriculture, etc.              Engaging with other stakeholders like financiers, industry, multilateral development banks (MDBs), Government institutions, funders, advisory agencies, etc. in possible areas of collaboration                      Qualifications & Experience            The candidate should have a commitment to CPI s mission and values and a passion for addressing climate change related policy and finance issues. S/he should also have at least an active interest in working in the impact space. Besides, s/he should have the following credentials.                A Post Graduate in Management/Finance or Chartered Accountant or Chartered Financial Analyst or have an equivalent experience              Significant post-qualification experience in relevant financial services, e.g. investment banking, transaction advisory, corporate finance, credit rating and corporate banking.              Significant experience of preparing financial projection models and deriving relevant ratios and valuation metrics out of them                    Desirable              Demonstrated experience of closing term sheets from either buy-side or sell-side as part of investment banks, multilateral development banks (MDBs)/ development financial institutions (DFIs) or acquirer/ acquiree entities                    Competencies & Personal Attributes              An independent, analytical mind with an excellent track record of applying sound financial judgement to complex issues.          Flexibility, professionalism, self-drive and enthusiasm for working as part of a team, with minimum guidance          An ability to interact with a diverse array of people.          An ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.                  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills including fluency in English; ability to write appraisal reports or research reports quickly with depth of analysis and clarity of articulation              Willingness to travel domestically.

column2: The Indian power market is evolving rapidly       The increasing share of variable renewable energy in the electricity system requires a flexible grid, financially sound and efficient power distribution companies and demand to serve as a resource     Achieving these outcomes would need dynamic regulations, new business models, innovative financial instruments, and robust institutional frameworks       To      enhance grid-flexibility     , CEEW team studies the current and future power systems to inform planning and operations, and procurement and dispatch of electricity in cost-effective ways     We undertake grid simulation exercises, and techno-economic analyses for emerging solutions such as large-scale energy storage, coal flexibilization, and new technologies such as offshore wind       The candidate in this role will lead      power system studies     and undertake quantitative and qualitative      analysis of issues concerning integration of variable renewables     with the grid and      market-based procurement of power         The candidate will work extensively on modelling platforms, CEEW s internal data analytics platforms, and other tools such as excel and Python                     Job Duties and Accountabilities           Programme strategy and management                Contribute to advancing the programme strategy by building on the team s progress and skillsets, assessment of ongoing work in the sector, emerging system challenges, and government priorities             Engage with donors, as well as new and potential partners to further the work programme objectives             Ideate new research concepts with team members, develop project proposals and budgets, secure resources for building and expanding the work programme, and deliver high-quality, timely outputs               Strategise communication and outreach of research outputs and ensure implementation of outreach plans             Support team members to work on their strengths and complement each other for driving impact             Build and maintain strong relationships with key policymakers and sector stakeholders based on trust and credibility             Research               Conceptualise and implement projects related to resource adequacy assessments, establishing the value and role of diverse clean energy resources (solar, onshore wind, offshore wind, storage, demand side management) in meeting demand across states and regions, and simulating the power system operations and optimal capacity mix at the national and sub-national level               Analyse data pertaining to existing and emerging challenges with high RE penetration in the grid (such as net load variability, transmission bottlenecks, transmission outages /loss of load, reactive power needs, stress on other operating assets and other technical issues) and identify mitigation strategies               Design and simulate modelling scenarios to reflect transition challenges and opportunities, as well as realities of the current system, analyse model outputs and distil policy and regulatory insights               Lead efforts to build input databases for modelling exercises by designing templates and enabling data collection from concerned departments and stakeholders at the state-level                Conduct regular discussions with stakeholders, especially with state load dispatchers, regulators, discoms and other research organisations to understand the needs and challenges, gather inputs and disseminate outputs                Regularly track important policy and regulatory developments in the sector and conduct rigorous literature review for informing the modelling efforts of the team               Write high-quality research reports and publishing in leading peer-reviewed journals               Generate knowledge content through blogs and policy briefs and prepare presentations, fact sheets, and other research communication materials             Selection Criteria           Qualification               A master s degree in power systems / power systems management, energy economics, and related fields                Any certifications related to power system modelling and power market operations would be desirable               Work experience               5-7 years of relevant work experience             Knowledge of power markets in advanced and emerging economies will be an advantage             Key skills               Strong analytical and research skills, and proficiency in using tools such as Plexos, GridPath, PyPSA, and MS excel               Stakeholder engagement and influencing                Ability to learn new tools to manage, process and drive insights from datasets               Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team and deliver timely outputs               Strong written and verbal communication skills
column11: Procurement, Stakeholder Engagement, Publishing, Penetration, Renewable energy, Simulation, Analytical, Power distribution, Data collection, CRM

column2: Senior Consultant/SME: We are looking for an accomplished Senior Consultant/SME in Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) with a comprehensive understanding of overall IPR policy-making, ease of compliance, IP enforcement, bilateral and multilateral negotiations, and expertise in legal and policy knowledge. As a Senior Consultant/SME, you will be instrumental in shaping and implementing business strategies related to IPR policy objectives and actively participating in international cooperation and negotiations. And experience in legal matters, amendments, and compliance projects, also have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Eligibility Criteria: Minimum educational qualification- Master's Degree in Law. Age limit for applicant has been fixed at 50 years or below as on the advertisement publication date. Minimum 15 years of work experience in the Middle management level or executive head in technical. Prior working experience in IPR. Desirable:    Preference would be given to candidates having educational qualification specialization in IPR Applicants with MPhil., Ph.D, would be preferred. Candidates with experience more than minimum requirement.  Preference would be given to candidates having specialization in IPR specifically in Patents.  Experience in legal matters, amendments, and compliance projects. Prior experience of working with a Government organization/Department. Job Responsibilities: IPR Policy Formulation: Lead the development and formulation of comprehensive IPR policies aligned with organizational objectives. Provide strategic insights and recommendations for enhancing and updating existing policies. Compliance Enhancement: Evaluate and streamline processes to ensure ease of compliance with IPR laws, rules, and       regulations. Collaborate with internal teams to implement compliance-friendly practices. IP Enforcement: Develop and implement strategies to strengthen IP enforcement mechanisms. Work closely with relevant authorities and stakeholders to enhance enforcement capabilities. Bilateral and Multilateral Negotiations: Drive bilateral and multilateral negotiations related to intellectual property rights. Represent the organization in international forums, fostering collaboration and partnerships. Manage matters pertaining to the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO). Research and Analysis: Conduct thorough research and analysis of IPR laws, rules, and global trends. Stay updated on emerging issues and innovations in the field of intellectual property. Treaty Making Exercise: Lead and participate in treaty-making exercises, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Provide expert input on the negotiation and drafting of international agreements. Policy Implementation: Oversee the effective implementation of IPR policies across the organization. Monitor and assess the impact of policies, making adjustments as needed. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including government agencies, industry bodies, and legal experts. Build and maintain relationships with key partners to advance organizational objectives. Collaborate with various stakeholders to reduce compliance challenges and enhance the IP reform process. Legal and Policy Knowledge: Provide expert advice on legal matters related to IPR. Stay informed about changes in laws and regulations impacting intellectual property. Experience in matters related to amendments of laws, rules, and bye-laws. Handle legal matters and participate in legal and compliance-related projects. Advisory Services: Provide expert advisories on international free trade agreements. Offer guidance on legal and policy matters within the realm of intellectual properties. Leadership and Mentoring: Provide leadership and mentorship to junior team members. Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment. Travel Requirements: Demonstrate the ability and willingness to undertake travel within India and, if needed, abroad. Ad Hoc Responsibilities: Undertake any other responsibilities assigned by the organization.

column2: Talent & Organization Organizational Analytics Consultant Looking for a rewarding career with global impact?  Then consider Accenture's rapidly expanding Capability Network with approximately 3,000 Management Consulting and Strategy professionals (we like to call them rock stars!) based in a network of prominent locations around the world.  Capability Network Professionals. Thrive in a fast-paced, inclusive environment with countless opportunities to learn and grow Collaborate with diverse organizations on groundbreaking projects Enjoy the camaraderie of working together towards a common goal and forming lasting friendships If this sounds like the right team for you, we invite you to read on - and visit . YOUR ROLE Although no two days at Accenture are the same, as an  Organizational Analytics (OA) Consultant  in our Talent & Organization (T&O) practice, a typical day might include: Comfortable with developing and deploying data-driven solutions to People transformation efforts for Accenture's Global and Local clients Engage with clients to understand their challenges, requirements and concerns to determine the best OA solution Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to develop business solutions Define data-backed people strategies to support business transformational programs Co-create solutions and assist clients in developing action plans Build strong relationships with clients and foster business growth Contribute to T&O practice-building efforts Qualification BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  MBA/Master's degree REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/ SKILLS 5 to 6 years of experience in people analytics and people management-related programs (workforce transformation, workforce M&A strategy, culture transformations, I&D strategy etc.) Working knowledge on interpreting Natural Language Processing (NLP) based ML model results Good to have NLP project exposure on any domain. Knowing to run python-based ML algorithms is an added advantage. Data fluency and working knowledge of statistical methodologies. Understanding of generative AI techniques such as variational autoencoders (VAEs), generative adversarial networks (GANs), and autoregressive models. Data interpretation with working knowledge of analytic models and digital tools Fluency in English is required, additional language capabilities are highly advantageous Ability to perform in a non-structured and dynamic environment LOCATION REQUIREMNTS  Gurugram, Mumbai, Bengaluru YOUR WINNING QUALITIES: Natural leader; easily establishes relationships with clients and colleagues Team Player; enjoys the intellectual stimulation of collaborating with colleagues around the world Determined; appreciates a challenge and overcoming obstacles to achieve results Digitally savvy; continuous learner OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU You will enjoy: A transparent career path designed for rapid career progression A supportive culture that is serious about training, coaching and continuous learning A global network where only state-of-the-art tools and technologies will do A bighearted environment with opportunities to give back to our local communities Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

column2: SME/Consultant:   We are seeking an experienced SME/ Consultant specializing in Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), possessing a holistic grasp of IPR policy formulation, streamlined compliance procedures, robust IP enforcement mechanisms, and proficiency in legal and policy intricacies. In the capacity of a SME/Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in influencing and executing business strategies aligned with IPR policy goals. Additionally, you will actively contribute to international cooperation and negotiations. The ideal candidate should bring substantial experience in legal affairs, encompassing amendments and compliance projects within the domain of Intellectual Property Rights. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are imperative for effective collaboration with internal teams and external stakeholders. Eligibility Criteria: Minimum educational qualification- Master's Degree in Law. Age limit for applicant has been fixed at 45 years or below as on the advertisement publication date. Minimum 10 years of work experience in the Middle management level or executive head in technical. Prior working experience in IPR. Desirable:   Preference would be given to candidates having educational qualification specialization in IPR. Applicants with MPhil., Ph.D, would be preferred. Candidates with experience more than minimum requirement.  Preference would be given to candidates having specialization in IPR specifically in Patents.  Experience in legal matters, amendments, and compliance projects. Prior experience of working with a Government organization/Department. Job Responsibilities: Develop and      Implement IPR Business Strategies: Formulate and execute strategies aligned with IPR policy       objectives. Drive the implementation of policies and procedures to enhance       intellectual property rights. Research and      Analysis: Conduct in-depth research on IPR laws, rules, and regulations. Streamline IP policy and procedures based on comprehensive       analysis. Stakeholder      Coordination: Collaborate with various stakeholders to reduce compliance       challenges and enhance the IP reform process. column2: The role holder provides support to the Underwriter and ensures that the administrative processes for the policy lifecycle are run efficiently and at a high quality to serve internal and external clients. They ensure a resilient knowledge foundation by gaining advanced expertise in multiple processes and/or lines of business and assume responsibility for overall pre-blind and post-blind policy maintenance/governance. They might be working on the end-to-end processes and/or hold a Resilient Processing Authority. This role is meant to be Resilient.  DISCOVER your opportunity What will your  essential responsibilities include? Providing comprehensive assistance to the underwriter and guidance to the coding and Issuance Unit if such exists, throughout the policy lifecycle. Pre-underwriting, evaluating risk, and assessing the completeness of the underwriting package before the underwriter is required to review. Managing the workflow of multiple tasks and maintaining a detailed understanding of the status of various tasks owned by the underwriter, Brokers, Reinsurers AXA XL internal network and fronting partners, and network partners around the world. Proactive problem-solving to balance and manage client/broker/UW expectations and internal service standards. Acting as a Subject Matter Expert and a role model on the process tools used and/or providing long-term support to the other members on top of daily duties. Collaborating closely with the Underwriter, Project Management, legal and Regulatory as necessary to perform pre/post-blind activities and confirm policy issuance instructions and manuscript wordings, Regulatory notices, certificates etc. to effectively instruct the Coding and Issuance unit if, such exists. Assessing when necessary and performing quality control of rating, coding, and issuance output to ensure accuracy (e.g., exposure basis, limits, coverage extensions, modifications and data entry etc.). Training and mentoring the new team member to support their learning, as well as for the coding & Issuance unit if, such exists. Conducting sessions for ESS teams to boost knowledge and enhance effectiveness across the organization. Preparing and maintaining documentation of the existing and future processes, including detailed process maps (as and when required) Constantly challenging existing processes, looking for improvement opportunities and participating in process improvement projects between ESS and MO/UW. Actively supporting transition planning & execution. Looking to engage in projects and opportunities to collaborate with other individuals/teams onshore and offshore. Adhering to Service Level Agreements and quality targets set by Global Operations in agreement with Underwriting (when applicable) Using workflow and time-tracking tools to ensure proper work organization and reporting (when applicable). Supporting in different time zone to provide coverage to business as applicable.  You will report to the Manager-Policy Management. Were looking for someone who has these abilities and skills: Required Skills and Abilities: Graduate in any discipline, preferably in insurance and Commerce or Financial & Accounting. Candidate with relevant years of experience within AXA XL or the Insurance domain. Very good knowledge of Insurance/Underwriting. Effective knowledge of policy management tools. Proficient in reading and comprehending Insurance industry-related correspondence and memos. Excellent written and oral communication skills and confidence to speak up in team meetings as well as with senior colleagues and stakeholders. Problem-solving attitude, great work organization skills. Effective analytical skills and ability to work resiliently and under my own initiative. Should be deadline-driven and can work under pressure. Ability to perform the processes with zero supervision. Ability to support the team manager from the technical perspective as an SME. Desired Skills and Abilities: Technical knowledge. Social Intelligence. Result-Outcome focus. Analytical Thinking. Client Service. Negotiating and Persuading.

column2: Lilly is looking for a social listening analyst to help uncover insights and develop actionable recommendations for how to optimize social media performance at Lilly. The Social Listening analyst will help deliver ongoing social listening reports for business partners via the NetBase social analytics platform. This position will report directly to the BIA lead at LCCI with a dotted line into the social listening lead on the US Consumer Marketing Social Media team.             Responsibilities           Social Listening Platform Industry Knowledge           Working    knowledge of social listening platforms such as NetBase, Brandwatch, Sprinklr, Spredfast, Crimson Hexagon, Sprout Social, Meltwater, Hoot Suite, Talkwalker       Ability    to assimilate extensive amounts of detailed data and to see the big picture, providing actionable and influential recommendations.       Pharmaceutical    Industry Knowledge and the ability to understand data that could impacts Lilly and Lilly brands, what is going on and react quickly.       Research    Skills: Basic knowledge of research methods and statistics, and qualitative research skills including the ability to interpret unstructured data and translate it into actionable insights       Social    Media expertise: stay up to date with the latest social media trends and technologies         Social Listening and Social Monitoring           Social    Listening Experience: Leverage technology to proactively explore and discover insights from online conversations made by users to understand the why which can inform strategic decision making. Examples include category analysis, competitive analysis or a brand health analysis.       Social    Monitoring: Leverage social technology to react and respond to topics or specific posts made by users on social networks. Monitoring can tell you the so what and enhance brand engagement. Examples include new product launch, campaign launch, crisis management, conference monitoring.         Cross-Functional Work           Independently    research questions or issues. When needed escalate issues for assistance within the broader social listening team.       Work    within the set service level agreements for US Marketing across all brands as prioritized by social listening lead.       Design,    conduct and deliver standard and custom social listening and monitoring reports.       Ability    to recognize opportunities, formulate hypotheses, plan research, identify insights, and drive recommendations relevant to the business goals and objectives.       Accountable    for deciphering what is important and meaningful data and then communicate a concise story in a way that allows the business to make decisions based off of the communicated reports.       Communicates    clearly using dashboards, PowerPoint presentations, or simple text depending on the amount of information that needs to be relayed.     The position will operate in an agile team concept designed to allow flexibility to execute the above job responsibilities as either dedicated, partially dedicated, and/or working across multiple brands. The incumbent should expect the alignment to a specific brand and/or therapeutic area to change based upon business need and the duration of alignment will vary.           Basic Qualifications             BA/BS    degree with a major in marketing, communications, business, IT or other closely related areas       Experience    with at least one of the Social Listening Platforms: NetBase, Brandwatch, Sprinklr, Spredfast, Crimson Hexagon, Sprout Social, Meltwater, Hoot Suite, Talkwalker       Broad    expertise and understanding of digital landscape, digital channels and social media.       Collaborative    in nature and ability to work across multiple functions.       Ability    to respect and work effectively with diverse teams.       Customer    Service mindset.           Additional Skills/Preferences             Experience    gleaning insights that support organizational goals       Expert    knowledge of social media landscape and a strong interest in emerging technologies       Working    knowledge of paid social media tactics       Naturally    curious; inspired by the road less traveled and finding creative solutions that others haven t considered       Analytical    by nature, but able to translate data into insights with a story telling mentality       Demonstrated    commitment going above beyond to help business partners or system users in solving problems or finding information

column2: Remuneration    : Competitive salary commensurate with experience        Type:        Project Based (3 months starting from June 2024)        Qualification required    : Masters/Doctoral degree in rural development/social/biological science or allied subjects        Experience required:        -: Minimum 5 years of experience in research and MLE      Ability to handle and analyze large datasets      Experience of knowledge development and evidence generation in a reputed organization              POSITION BRIEF:            The consultant will help, advise, and engage with PCI India in planning and executing analytical frameworks, cleaning, formatting, managing and analyzing data engaging with the key team members.      The consultant will also conduct necessary literature review, at times systematic reviews to develop proofs of concept, scientific / methodological / statistical basis to build rationale of analytical processes      The consultant will work closely with the select members of the PCI Concurrent Measurement and Learning (CML) team headed by the Senior Director Measurement, Learning and Evaluation, PCI India.      The work includes a close review of the existing tools, programs, documents, available datasets, standard operating procedures regarding data management, analysis and interpretation available with PCI and its partners.      The consultant may need to identify key thematic areas for developing analytical pathways, indicator matrix and statistical explanations with other team members of PCI. Basic analysis may have already been done; the consultant may have to undertake additional data analysis.      Based on the complete analysis of data, the consultant may need to develop final tables, formatted for scientific manuscripts, power point presentations, academic and programmatic syntheses and white papers as well as lay summaries and dissemination materials.      There will be requirement of sharing all these materials with respective team members, management staff and eco-system partners to get review feedback and get them incorporated to finalize.      PCI will acknowledge the work of the consultant appropriately and offer co-authorship when the products will be published. However, PCI retains the rights of citation and fixing the order of the authorship.                Key Deliverables      :          Deliverable Set 1:        i) Re-identifying appropriate journal and accordingly formatting the manuscript for the resubmission of the revised manuscript: Diffusion of health and nutritional intervention effectiveness from Self Help Group members to non-members: an assessment in rural Bihar and completing the resubmission      ii) Reidentifying appropriate journal and formatting the manuscript: Unravelling the multiplier effect of health and nutritional interventions through self-help group platforms and frontline health worker channels: the Bihar story of India and the citations according to the journal requirements and submitting to the journal.        Deliverable Set 2:        i) Reidentifying appropriate journal and formatting the manuscript: Role of SHG members in JTSP blocks for strengthening family planning practices along with FLW-A joint impact and the citations according to the journal requirements and submitting to the journal.      ii) Reidentifying appropriate journal, revising the whole manuscript: IYCF practices and its drivers among SHG members in JTSP blocks- Overall program as well as joint impact and diffusion of recommended practices addressing all collaborators comments, finalizing the manuscript according to the journal and submittiong.        Deliverable 3:        Identifying appropriate journal for the manuscript developed on the Swasthya Mitra assessment study , formatting all tables and the text for the journal and getting it submitted after addressing all comments from the internal reviewers and collaborators on the manuscript.              What can you expect in PCI              A warm, inclusive and happy work environment.      Performance driven reward mechanism.      Best of class benefits with competitive remunerations.      Health Insurance coverage for self, spouse & Children.      Group Terms Life Insurance and Group Accident Insurance for Self.      All other statutory benefits.      Regular Recognition of performance and PCI Value display in work      An empowering organisation structure which values individuals skills, competencies and potential.      Opportunities to operate in cross functional role.      Higher responsibilities and larger roles are merit based.      Young Talent Programs for developing future leaders.      Leadership roles for women is encouraged and given preference in selection and training.

column2: The overall purpose and main responsibilities are listed below:          Assist HEVA team in assigned therapy area portfolio to plan and generate robust health economics and value based evidence to maximize the value propositions from both a global and US perspective working within the Market Access tripod          Contribute to the execution of quality research projects, economic models, trial design recommendations and other activities in support of programs/products          Seek opportunities to innovate HEVA value identification, evidence generation and dissemination process/plan to increase the relevance and impact of HEVA evidence to ensure reimbursement decisions optimal access          Develop and maintain TA expertise              People: (1) Support and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders (2) Work effectively with global HEVA teams across various time zones          Performance: (1) Contribute in the HEVA evidence generation plan: Support activities for research plan for pre-launch, launch and post-launch evidence for investigational and marketed drugs; Evidence generation plan includes burden of illness studies, epidemiology, literature reviews, meta-analysis, retrospective, and prospective observational studies, economic evaluations, development and analysis of patient-reported outcomes; Provide support with individuals and institutions, which may serve as resources for evidence generation purpose, etc. (2) Support execution of approved HEVA study(s) and manage ongoing study(s) if required: Supports the manager/HEVA product lead to manage and execute research studies to support the clinical, economic and humanistic value of products; Studies include but are not limited to burden of illness studies, epidemiology, literature reviews, meta-analysis, retrospective and prospective observational studies, economic evaluations, and patient-reported outcomes (3) Support development of core value dossier (CVD) and AMCP dossiers and provide strategic direction          Process: (1) Assist HEVA team in development of HEVA strategic evidence material (2) Contribute in development of core HEVA strategic evidence generation processes, templates, and products across the portfolio in accordance to the scientific and value messages aligned with CVD, the US AMCP dossier, and HEVA contributions as appropriate to other submissions (3) Maintain adherence to the evidence generation guidelines and other standards relevant to HEVA evidence generation processes          Stakeholder: (1) Work with HEVA, RWE, Clinical, Medical Affairs, Marketing, External Affairs and Market Access global or local teams in regions/areas to identify evidence generation and dissemination needs and assist in developing assigned deliverables (2) Assist HEVA team to prepare relevant customized deliverables for these Teams                About you              Experience    : 3+ years of experience in HEOR for the pharmaceuticals industry, CRO consultancy or academia. column2: The Policy Research and Planning domain, DA is looking for a    Consultant Climate Change    to join the team on a short-term contract.              You would work directly with the Team Lead, Policy Research and Planning Domain and support the overall development of the sustainable finance programme across advisory on policy research and advocacy, partnership development, capacity building and knowledge management, pertaining to Climate change policy.                      Scope of Work                     Identify key impact areas to work on climate change in India, related policies to influence and actors to mobilise, and develop policy papers as required.                  Building a case for India s participation in the UNFCCC COP 29 in 2024, basis COP 28 in 2023, and support with G20 interventions as they emerge                 Develop and manage effective partnerships with government and civil society organisations to mobilise resources for climate change adaptation and mitigation, transition financing, etc.                 Liaison with the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) and/or relevant State Government Departments, private investors and climate financing actors at the national level, as well as think tanks, coalitions and networks at the international level.                 Support the ongoing projects on climate change and sustainable financing with advocacy, knowledge, outreach and other support, as per need. column2: We are looking for those who understand the challenges of translating business needs into technical reality. Potential team members with prior job titles ranging from business analyst, systems analyst, requirements engineer, process analyst, product manager, product owner, enterprise analyst, business architect, QA analyst, and management consultant may find themselves challenged and rewarded in an Implementation Consultant position at Tyler.               Responsibilities:             Proactively communicate and collaborate with external customers and internal team members to identify, analyze, and document user stories and deliver artifacts such as requirements configuration design documents, data migration plans, and specifications, etc.         Act as the project expert regarding requirements elicitation, documentation, analysis (including gap analysis), and the communication of business needs         Understand the current state of the client organization, while at the same time track to the vision of where a client organization wants to be         Recommend options for new approaches in client work processes as appropriate to ensure efficient configuration of the SaaS platform for the client s needs that minimizes any need for custom development         Develop that understanding to serve as a basis for the later identification of business needs and to define solutions that meet business needs, goals, or objectives         Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously         Serve as the conduit between the customer community and the implementation team to achieve successful project acceptance         Represents Tyler in the most positive manner with prospective, former, and current clients, suppliers, and the community we serve         Interact effectively with a diverse group of team members and clients within Tyler, the industry, and government communities.         Play an active role in troubleshooting and resolving client issues by working closely with the Support or Development departments         Assist QA staff with product testing or modification testing and data validation as required          Notify management and appropriate organization/department of issues or unplanned events that could impact the effectiveness/schedule/budget of the implementation         Create implementation tools and documentation to iteratively improve implementation capabilities           Requirements:             2+ years of experience aligning the needs of business units with the capabilities delivered by information technology         Extensive experience facilitating formal requirements gathering sessions or workgroups         Facilitate a large group of multidisciplinary participants to agree on common objectives using advanced facilitation techniques to brainstorm, reduce conflicts and identify solutions         Expertise in eliciting the actual needs of stakeholders, not simply their expressed desires         Strong decision-making, analytical and problem-solving skills particularly in data migration validation         Excellent planning and organizational skills and ability to follow through until a given activity is complete         Exceptional independent judgment and customer service skills         Strong work ethic and commitment to excellence and an aptitude for customer success          Strong organizational, documentation, and prioritization skills          Self-motivated, open, and creative personality          Desire to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment maintaining agreed upon timelines while producing extraordinary work.          Travel will be required at times for necessary on-site customer engagement.
