column2: Bains    Summer Associate (SA)    program is more than just a summer internship      It's a springboard to your whole career and could quite possibly be the best summer of your life      It s an ideal opportunity for MBAs or advanced degree candidates [eg, JD, PhD, MD] who would like to experience the real world of consulting while getting insight into what a future with Bain would be like      The program starts with an intensive training to learn core consulting skills      you'll work alongside Bain knowledge experts tackling complex business challenges and use your skills to help drive change in a range of organizations from global leaders to start-ups      Most SAs are amazed at the wealth of industry knowledge, client management and communication skills they acquire      you'll also have the opportunity to secure a full-time offer to join Bain as a consultant upon completion of your studies          WHAT you'll DO:          Client confidentiality means we cannot tempt you with our clients names, but whether you're interested in consumer electronics, finance, transportation, healthcare, energy or non-profits, the chances are good that you already know the clients we work with      They are well-known leaders in their respective industries        Over the course of the summer - often at the    global office    of your choice - you will work directly with case teams and clients to solve business problems and drive change, being immersed in the responsibilities of a full-time Bain consultant, including        Working closely with full-time consultants [who will provide coaching and mentoring]      Working with clients from Fortune 500 companies, midsize firms, non-profits and start-ups across many fast-changing industries such as consumer goods and retail, technology and telecommunication, financial services, industrial products, private equity and many others      Presenting the results of your work to Partners and clients      Applying knowledge and skills from your first year of business school, you will gain access to an unparalleled range and depth of opportunities              ABOUT YOU:          Studying for an MBA or advanced degree from a top business school or university      A solid team player who s also an independent thinker      A robust analytical skillset, endless curiosity and a penchant to think the impossible      Must be deadline driven, organized and able to multi-task      Strong verbal, written and presentation skills are important      Fluency in English      Any additional language and visa requirements for the office you wish to join
column11: SAS, Analytical, Consulting, Healthcare, Telecommunication, Internship, Financial services, Client management, Private equity, Consumer electronics

column2: A career within Internal Audit services, will provide you with an opportunity to gain an understanding of an organisation s objectives, regulatory and risk management environment, and the diverse needs of their critical stakeholders     We focus on helping organisations look deeper and see further considering areas like culture and behaviours to help improve and embed controls     In short, we seek to address the right risks and ultimately add value to their organisation     As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution         PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:           Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.     Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.     Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.     Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.     Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.     Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.     Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.     Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.     Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:           Manage a team of Associates (if needed) or independently deliver SOX engagements for multiple processes across client(s).         Participate or drive conversations with the clients for process discussions and conduct walkthroughs.         Sound understanding of key business processes such as PTP, OTC, Inventory, Payroll, Fixed Asset etc and the Risk and Controls associated with the process.         Basis process discussions prepare process flows / narratives and risk & control matrices.         Identify process gaps and accordingly provide recommendations in areas requiring improvement based on the clients business process and industry practice.         Conduct (and review, if needed) test of design and operating effectiveness, and suggest controls to improve the client s control framework.         Document testing workpapers as per the defined standards and quality benchmark         Support the Manager in conducting SOX scoping, control rationalization & standardization for business processes         Monitor project progress, manage multiple assignments/ related project teams, if needed         Meet quality guidelines within the established turnaround time (or allotted budget) for assigned requests         Provide regular status update to the Manager on the controls         Demonstrate application and solution-based approach to problem solving         while executing client engagements and documenting working papers               Interpersonal Skills:           Ability to work independently under general supervision with latitude for initiative and independent judgment         Effective verbal and written communications, including active listening skills         Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers and external contactors/auditors         Detail-oriented         Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously         Individuals would be expected to cultivate a strong team environment and promote a positive working relationship amongst their team.          Excellent Communication, written and verbal would be expected.         In addition to being an exceptional individual contributor, manage engagements and relevant Teams allocated for the same.          Managing predominantly offshore engagements and relevant PwC Territory teams.         Ensure client service delivery in accordance with the quality guidelines & methodologies.         Build and maintain client relationships by understanding and being responsive to client needs and ensuring high quality of deliverables.         Demonstrate strong analytical thinking and communication skills including the ability to research and understand complex processes and effectively communicate them to interested parties               Client Management:               Develop strong working relationships with the client and onshore client teams.         Maintain excellent rapport and proactive communication with the stakeholders and client.                Operational excellence:               Suggest ideas on improving engagement productivity and identify opportunities for improving client service.          Ensure compliance with engagement plans and internal quality & risk management procedures.                People related:           Display teamwork, integrity, and leadership. Work with team members to set goals and responsibilities for specific engagements.          Foster teamwork and innovation.          Utilize technology & tools to continually learn and innovate, share knowledge with team members and enhance service delivery.          Conduct workshops and technical training sessions for team members.          Contribute to the learning & development agenda and knowledge harnessing initiatives.               Minimum Qualifications:           Bachelors/masters Degree in Commerce / B. Com / MBA/ BBA         Chartered Accountant         Experience of business experience in technology audit, risk management, compliance, consulting, or information security         Experience in identifying control gaps and communicating audit observation and recommendation to Engagement Team/ End Clients         Functional knowledge of major ERP suites (like SAP, Dynamics, Oracle EBS)         Understanding of audit concepts and regulations         Candidates with 3-5 years of relevant experience in similar role, preferably with a Big 4 or equivalent                 Certification(s) preferred:              CA / CPA / CIA

column2: A career within SAP Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients maximise the value of their SAP investment with offerings that address sales, finance, supply chain, engineering, and human capital      We provide comprehensive consulting, system integration and implementation services across multiple SAP applications, products and technologies      Simply put, we focus on delivering business led, technology enabled change for our clients including industry specific enterprise resource planning and the latest in mobile, analytics and cloud solutions                  Job Description:            In your role as a Business Process Consultant - SAP S/4HANA BRIM CI and FICA consultant, you will be responsible to provide advisory and implementation services to evaluate, design, and configure end to end business processes as per the industry standard processes of CI and FICA engagements for cross industries      You will collaborate closely work with your team members to ensure success of the customer          Following would be the roles and responsibilities:          Engage with C-level stake holders in understanding business requirements, current solution landscape and propose newer solutions and applications that provide enhanced value from customer perspective.    Provide expert consulting services for customers and projects on SAP BRIM.              Design and configure the system for convergent invoicing such as,      o Consumption Item Classes,    o Billable Item Classes,    o Grouping Variants,    o Rating,    o Billing,    o Invoicing,    o partner settlement,    o Preliminary Invoice,    o Master Agreement,    o Enhancement approach for CITs and BITs,    o Integration with other BRIM modules like SOM, FICA, CC              Design and configure the system for FICA such as      o Contract Account,    o Main /Sub transactions,    o Clearing rules,    o Dunning,    o Tax,    o Refund Process,    o Write offs,    o Installment Plans,    o Promise to Pay,    o Interest Calculation,    o Automatic Clearing,    o Account Maintenance,    o Processing outgoing and incoming payments,    o Email correspondence    o Clarification of Invoices        Transfer of account assignment data from Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable to Finance and Controlling (FICO)      Parallel processing and Enhancement of standard business processes of Contract Accounts      Receivable and Payable using predefined program events.      End-to-End integration with SAP and Non-SAP components.      Prepare business process design document, Functional specification configuration documents and test scripts as per the project requirement.      Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation.      Propose and implement solutions to improve efficiency and accuracy.      Experience with SAP implementation methodologies, JIRA or SAP Solution Manager is preferred.          Experience:          bachelors degree in technology/Engineering or a related field. masters degree would be good to have.      At least 4 years of implementation experience in SAP BRIM with at-least 2 full lifecycle implementations.      Having SAP BRIM certification is a plus.      Strong communication, facilitation, relationship-building, presentation, and negotiation skills.      Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.      Strong communication and interpersonal skills.      Ability to work independently and as part of a team.                Mandatory Skillset - SAP BRIM, CI-FICA, E2E implementation              Preferred Skillset - Consulting experience              Qualification - BE / BTech / ME / MTech / MCA / MBA / CA / ICWA

efficiencies, and harness the power of technology     Our Application Security Application Evolution Services team will provide you with the opportunity to help companies rethink their approach to risk and create a sustainable risk advantage     Were a part of a unique client proposition, assisting our clients develop proper internal controls by leveraging analytics and technology solutions to underpin efficient execution of governance, to optimise their risk and compliance policies and processes and improve business performance     This role will allow you to operate solutions to help clients leverage enterprise technologies (eg SAP, Oracle) so they can get a higher return on their investment     The solutions we deliver help our clients avoid financial and operational risks, improve business performance across business cycles and reduce operational inefficiencies by streamlining their technology enabled capabilities     Implementing a new enterprise resource planning system can be a huge investment for our clients and they dont always see the results as they operate after go-live     You will assist companies in getting the most of their Enterprise Resource Planning systems by monitoring their application security based on leading practice including segregation of duties and sensitive access     you'll also monitor security design principles to ensure Job Title: SAP Security Consultant         Job Overview:         The person hired for the position of SAP Security Consultant will help support the GRC team with problem solving and present solution options related to SAP Security     It is the consultant s responsibility to research the options and present the solutions, and work with all parties involved to determine the correct solution     The Security Consultant must be able to handle multiple issues at once     The Security Consultant will be expected to work immediately with other GRC team members, and the various SAP Security Authorization Concepts in ERP / CRM / HCM / BW / SCM / SRM / BPC, and Hana     This position demands focus and attention to detail, as the quality of your work will be directly related to the security of the customer's data         Job Description:         Understanding of a technical definition of an SAP System and Client, and ability to communicate with others and discuss the system landscape.     Experience with SAP GUI and navigation using transaction codes, shortcuts and key commands.     Knowledge and experience working with LOBs within US such as Service Desk, Maintenance, AMS, Basis.     Experience with using various VPN software to connect to customers.     Perform SAP Role Design and SAP Role Maintenance following the customer's change management process, including documentation and Change Advisory Board (CAB).     Perform SAP User to Role Mapping.     Demonstrates basic knowledge of the design, implementation, and/or assessment of security, including an understanding of the systems implementation lifecycle, including configuring and optimizing business process application security.     Demonstrates basic understanding of business processes related to core SAP modules, including thorough knowledge of implementing security within SAP environments.     Experience in 3 or more End to End projects as a SAP Security consultant, including Blueprint, Design, Development, Testing, and Documentation of the SAP Security Project Plan.     Demonstrates basic understanding of business processes related to core SAP and SAP GRC modules, including thorough knowledge of industry-specific modules/products and/or a proven record of success configuring and implementing within SAP GRC environments.     Assessing, recommending and configuring financial and operational controls around the SAP application for Pre- and post-implementation assurance reviews of the SAP implementation project and upgrades.     Atleast 3-4 End to End GRC Access Controls experience is required in addition to GRC Process Controls Experience.                                                 Job Basic Requirements:           At least 5 years of experience with SAP Security         Minimum Bachelors Degree         Experience in diagnosing SAP authorization errors         Experience with security in the following SAP solutions (SAP ECC, HCM, BI/BW, CRM) is preferred         Experience and Knowledge of SAP security design and implementation methodology is preferred       Experience with MS-Excel and MS-Word       At least 5 year of experience with SAP GRC is required.         Minimum Bachelors Degree         Experience with majority of the following technologies (SAP ECC, BI/BW, BOBJ, CRM, SRM) is preferred.         Knowledge of SAP security design and implementation methodology is preferred.         Strong understanding of Internal Controls / Segregation of Duties Framework.       Knowledge of SAP GRC Access Control and, with involvement in the solution blue-printing, and a high level understanding of the typical use cases.     Implementation experience with SAP GRC Access Control and GRC Process Controls is a must.     Experience with SAP Solution Manager or Netweaver would be preferred     Knowledge in business process controls eg Segregation of Duties and Sensitive Access Transaction issues.

column2: A career in our Microsoft Dynamics team will provide the opportunity to help our clients transform their technology landscape across Front, Back and Mid-Office functions leveraging Microsoft Dynamics      We focus on contributing to PwC s value proposition of strategy led and technology enabled , by aligning our Consulting Solutions industry focus with the Microsoft technologies such as Dynamics 365, Azure, Power Platform and Power BI                  Job Description:            D365 f&O Technical Consultant/Senior Consultant - PwC        PwC is the leading global professional services firm and is acclaimed as one of the world's leading employers. PwC offers a rich experience in terms of the variety of projects it delivers, the caliber of its individuals, and the exceptional training and career development opportunities it provides for its people.      To develop our Microsoft capability at PwC, we are looking for people who enjoy the excitement of shaping new ideas and working as part of multi-disciplinary teams on complex challenges, where each project is likely to be different to the last.      We are looking for candidates with the passion and commitment, intellect and experience that can enable our clients success in the intensely competitive economic environment of the digital age.      Our unique strength at PwC is our ability to operate as one firm across multiple disciplines.      As well as providing Microsoft and consulting capabilities, we also bring the full range of our economics, assurance, risk, tax, deals, and corporate finance capabilities to bear on the real world problems our clients face.      Within consulting, we combine deep insight, functional expertise, powerful tools and practical experience, to deliver measurable, positive outcomes for our clients.      At PwC, we strive to become trusted advisers to our clients, delivering results that help them unleash their potential.      We are looking for candidates with the intellect, passion, commitment and desire to help our clients succeed in the intensely competitive economic environment.      The successful individuals will work with senior team members, to develop strategies and approaches to help our clients manage through periods of large scale change and equip them with the relevant skills to manage the impact associated with their Microsoft projects.      They will have the skills and experience to coach clients and teams to create alignment and advice on technical, process, cultural and behavioral change.          Competency / Capability / Experiences Skills          Ability to design solutions      Ability to estimate work packets/Projects      Delivered 3-4 large implementations or equivalent      Ability to lead a team      Uses creative ways to find solutions      Good verbal & written communication skills      Able to identify performance bottlenecks and fix it      Is certified on latest product at desired levels      Great Team Player      Ability to translate customer requirements in to solution design      Proficient in Delivery methodology (SureStep Preferable)                3 to 8 years of Work experience in IT Industry      D365 f&O/AX 2012 -R2/R3      Good knowledge of LCS, DevOps      Object Oriented Programming and Design      experience      Morph X / X++      Good understanding of AX entity & Object      model      Should be able to do estimations of AX      Customizations, Testing etc      SQL Programming and Query Tuning      SSRS Reporting      AIF, Workflows etc      Can plan and organize delivery of solution          Qualification:    BE/BTECH/MCA/BSC or equivalent        Travel requirements    Yes Job requires travel        Roles and Responsibilities        Develop in Dynamics AX to customize the product and reports as per the users business requirements      Set up the IT infrastructure and DBMS (database management system) required for Dynamics AX      Implement data migration and integration using Dynamics AX tools      Provide technical expertise for the Dynamics AX and Microsoft development technologies and environments.      Follow development best practices and document required technical artifacts related to the project      Work with AX functional team and client IT team for a common goal of a successful implementation      Should be able to work in a team environment and contribute towards      Practice/Project/Organization goals                Mandatory Skills: D365 Technical/F&O Technical    Qualifications: BE/B.tech

column2: A career within PwCs Oracle Services Practice, will provide you with the opportunity to help organizations use enterprise technology to achieve their digital technology goals and capitalize on business opportunities. We help our clients implement and effectively use Oracle offerings to solve their business problems and fuel success in the areas of finance operations, human capital management, supply chain management, reporting and analytics, and governance, risk and compliance.               ?       Key responsibilities of an Oracle Fusion Technical       ?     1. Extensive experience in Oracle ERP/Fusion SaaS/PaaS project implementations as a technical developer   2. Completed at least 2 full Oracle Cloud (Fusion) Implementation   3. Extensive Knowledge on database structure for ERP/Oracle Cloud (Fusion) .Extensively worked on BI Publisher reports, FBDI/OTBI and Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC)   Strong technical knowledge on Oracle Database SQL and PLSQL   4. Providing technical support and troubleshooting for Oracle Fusion applications.   5. Collaborating with functional consultants to ensure that technical solutions meet business requirements.   6. Developing and executing test plans to ensure the quality of technical solutions.   7. Providing technical leadership and mentoring to junior team members.   8. Participating in the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including requirements   gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment.   9. Staying up-to-date with emerging Oracle technologies and best practices, and providing recommendations to clients for new technology solutions.   10. Providing input into project plans, timelines, and budgets.   11. Communicating effectively with clients, project managers, and other team members to ensure that technical solutions are delivered on-time and within budget.                     ?     Mandatory skill sets-    Oracle technical     Qualifications-    Btech/Mba

End to end implementation experience in oracle cloud / ERP applications.      Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with external teams or clients.      Experience in working with client / USA counterparts in understanding their business requirements and providing the right solutions.

column2: A career in our Government and Public Sector Transformation Management practice, within General Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities     We work with some of the world s largest and most complex companies to understand their unique business issues and opportunities in an ever changing environment     We help create sustainable change by stimulating innovation, unlocking data possibilities, navigating risk and regulatory complexity, optimising deals, and aligning costs with business strategy to create a competitive advantage     In joining, you'll help federal, state and local government clients solve complex business issues and manage jurisdiction related risk     you'll help our clients assess their operational and security and data management strategies so they can continue to operate more efficiently and effectively, both today and tomorrow     Business Unit: Advisory Sub BU: One Consulting (Responsible Development Services)   Expertise Keywords: Data Center Expert, Cloud Expert     The open position is for a candidate who desires to work with government clients and bring about a change in society.      A successful candidate will be expected to work pro-actively and   effectively on multiple client engagements over the period of time and take ownership of the entire project delivery he/she entrusted with.         Broad role typically entails our resources to adopt problem solving approach to solve important client problems and extend support in monitoring / managing large projects; involving following responsibilities:         Prepare the tender document for selection of new System Integrator and assist in the bid process management of the said tender.     Experience in Design, Implementation and Operations of Data Center Infrastructure Operations     Review the exit management and handover takeover plans.     Plan and monitor the migration from existing data centre to new data centre.     Perform technical evaluation of the high-level and detailed design documents related to data centre.     Analyse the product data sheets and be able to ascertain the technical specification compliance     Define the Acceptance Testing parameters and processes.     Review the data centre continuity setup for meeting the RTO/RPO.     Work with OEMs to ensure optimal configuration of hardware, software and network components.     Coordinate with the security team and application team for data centre operations     Keep track of the architectural and IT component documentation             Specific Past Work Experience Requirements         Experience of working in modern and state-of-art data centres in government or private sector.     Experience in Design, Implementation and Operations of Data Center Infrastructure Operations     Understand all components that play an essential role in the high-availability of Data Centre performance     Experience in Data Centre IT (Enterprise Servers, Hypervisors, Storages, Network Switches, Backup, Smart Racks, etc) and Non-IT components of different OEMs     Presales experience in system integrator firms is preferred     Exposure to on-premises setup ie, virtual private cloud setup is preferred     Experience in Migration of Data Centres is preferred.     Experience in Business Continuity Plan and Disaster Recovery of Data Centres is preferred     Experience in contract management, SLA review, ITIL, ITSM is preferred         Educational Qualifications (mandatory)         Full-Time - B.E./ B Tech/ MCA/ MBA         Certifications         Any industry standard Cloud Certification, like, AWS/ GCP/ CCCP, etc (Mandatory)     OEM certification in Server/Storage/Virtualization environment     Certified Data Center Expert (CDCE), Certified Data Center     Specialist (CDCS), Data Center     Infrastructure Expert (DCIE) (Preferred).         Personality traits (a must)         Strong communications skills, both written and verbal     Ability to handle complex assignment independently     Ability to work with ambiguity. Taking a systematic, structured view of situations.     Ability to interact with client (senior government officials)     Demonstrating willingness to do hands-on work and developing a problem-solving attitude     Strong personal and professional presence and self-confidence, capable of working effectively with senior team as well as all other levels.     PwC Professional leadership development framework focuses on   five core attributes: Whole leadership, Business acumen, Technical   capabilities, Global acumen and Relationships.     We use this framework to recruit, develop and assess our people, at   all grades and all areas of our business, helping our people to meet   the expectations of our clients, colleagues and communities in   todays changing global marketplace.             Mandatory Skills:          Data Center Expert, Cloud Expert, Design, Implementation and Operations of Data Center Infrastructure Operations      Understand all components that play an essential role in the high-availability of Data Centre performance      Experience in Data Centre IT (Enterprise Servers, Hypervisors, Storages, Network Switches, Backup, Smart Racks, etc) and Non-IT components of different OEMs      Presales experience in system integrator firms is preferred      Exposure to on-premises setup ie, virtual private cloud setup is preferred      Experience in Migration of Data Centres is preferred.      Experience in Business Continuity Plan and Disaster Rec
column11: Data management, Architecture, Contract management, Consulting, Disaster recovery, storage virtualization, Business strategy, Project delivery, Process management

column2: A career in our Government and Public Sector Transformation Management practice, within General Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities     We work with some of the world s largest and most complex companies to understand their unique business issues and opportunities in an ever changing environment     We help create sustainable change by stimulating innovation, unlocking data possibilities, navigating risk and regulatory complexity, optimising deals, and aligning costs with business strategy to create a competitive advantage     In joining, you'll help federal, state and local government clients solve complex business issues and manage jurisdiction related risk     you'll help our clients assess their operational and security and data management strategies so they can continue to operate more efficiently and effectively, both today and tomorrow                 Expertise Keywords:    Urban Mobility Expert, Traffic & Transport Expert, Enterprise System Architect.             Preface         The open position is for a candidate who desires to work with government clients and bring about a change in society     A successful candidate will be expected to work pro-actively and effectively on multiple client engagements over the period of time and take ownership of the entire   project delivery he/she entrusted with         Broad Role / Responsibilities         Formulating comprehensive strategies for urban mobility projects encompassing transport,traffic management, parking solutions, and last-mile connectivity.     Understanding on the overall urban mobility market in India for various solution and vendor eco-system knowledge.     Preparation of the technical blueprints, functional and technical benchmarks of the mobility solutions.      Expertise in understanding of the DPR, RFP, Concept Note and technical assessment documents for the mobility solutions.     Conducting feasibility studies to assess the viability of proposed mobility projects.     Engaging with various stakeholders including government bodies, STUs, PTOs and ULBs.     Identifying and integrating cutting-edge technologies for enhancing urban mobility.         Broad Experience & Expertise Requirements         Analyse current transportation systems and devise strategies to improve efficiency, accessibility, and sustainability. This involves studying traffic patterns, public transportation usage, and future growth projections.     Understanding of conceptualization and design traffic management systems to minimize congestion and improve traffic flow.     Assess parking needs and develop solutions to address parking shortages and improve utilization.     Knowledge of last-mile connectivity options, such as bike-sharing programs, micro-mobility solutions, and shuttle services.     Understanding on Integrating various urban mobility solutions into broader smart city initiatives.     Identify and recommend innovative technologies to enhance urban mobility.         Specific Past Work Experience Requirements         Experience in working with Urban Mobility projects (Transport, Traffic, Parking, Last Mile etc), Smart Cities, Smart Tourism etc     Must experience to work with Government & Public Sector in India.             Educational Qualifications         Bachelors degree in engineering / Architecture / Transport Planning / Urban Planning etc     Masters is an advantage.     Knowledge of EA -Enterprise Architecture, IT Operating Models is added advantage.     Certifications (in software)     Proficient in MS-Office (Presentations, Word, Excel deliverables)             Personality traits (a must)         Strong communications skills, both written and verbal     Ability to handle complex assignment independently.     Ability to work with ambiguity. Taking a systematic, structured view of situations.     Ability to interact with client (senior government officials)     Demonstrating willingness to get hands dirty and developing a problem-solving attitude     Strong personal and professional presence and self-confidence, capable of working effectively with     senior team as well as all other levels.         Mandatory Skills:         Experience in working with Urban Mobility projects (Transport, Traffic, Parking, Last Mile etc), Smart Cities, Smart Tourism etc     Proficient in MS-Office (Presentations, Word, Excel deliverables          Preferred Skills:    Urban Mobility Expert, Traffic & Transport Expert, Enterprise System Architect.        Qualifications   : Bachelors degree in Engineering / Architecture / Planning etc Masters is advantage.

column2: Role & responsibilities     This role will be a hybrid (50/50) of operation case management support and development/configuration within the ServiceNow HRSD platform. Operational work consists of daily/weekly audits, as well as monitoring a ticket queue which requires interaction with new joiners and employees. While many inquiries have documented resolutions, the good majority require judgment calls as not all situations are exactly the same. This requires working with other team members to identify the best path forward, learning from each other's experiences along the way. The Development work would initially consist of updates to tasks and communications within ServiceNow, as well as reporting and dashboards. As knowledge and experience grows, more responsibility will be given for catalog items, scripting and business rules. Job Description Preferred Knowledge/Skills: Demonstrates abilities and/or record of success at the following: Technical Acumen Performing day to day configuration within a technology platform including but not limited to workflows, catalog items, scripts and service portal; Possessing basic technical experience with ServiceNow HRSD or ITSM, Workday and other vendor SaaS systems; Coordinating between the business users, the software vendor and Information Technology (IT), and other groups using an Agile/Scrum methodology to integrate, enhance, and implement new systems and provide recommended solutions which meet the needs of the business; Previous consulting or business analyst experience. The best jia similar technology; and, Possessing the willingness and ability to secure appropriate ServiceNow certifications required to support, maintain and configure systems. Translating technical processes into common language for a wide audience; Business Acumen Understanding of Human Capital (HC) processes, procedures and reporting, specifically in the areas of OnBoarding, OffBoarding, Global Mobility and Case Management; Understanding how HC systems and future enhancements support both the Firms and HCs priorities, along with identifying potential downstream and upstream implications to other areas of People Operations; Being an iterative thinker with demonstrated experience working on teams who are solving problems with creativity while utilizing both positive and negative testing skills; Identifying user requirements, coordinating user acceptance testing and producing recommendations to improve the end user experience; Possessing experience aggregating various, often unrelated data points or data sets to determine root cause or to support processes that benefit multiple stakeholders or impact multiple systems cohesively; Identifying opportunities for process refinement or recreation and supporting effective brainstorming while functioning as a creative problem solver; Presenting information and insight to team leaders in both written and spoken methods of communication Creating & maintaining accurate documentation of business processes and standard operating procedures (SOPs), process maps, Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) & Quick Reference Cards (QRCs). MUST HAVE SERVICENOW HRSD EXPERIENCE AND CASE MANAGEMENT Shift:2pm-11pm

column2: To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every   one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us   achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It   gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides   transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers,   now and in the future.     As a Associate you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex   business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this   management level include but are not limited to:     Be curious and try new things.   Learn about how PwC works as a business and adds value to clients.   Think broadly and ask questions about data, facts and other information.   Support research, analysis and problem solving using a variety of tools and techniques.   Produce high quality work which adheres to the relevant professional standards.   Keep up-to-date with technical developments for area of specialism.   Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.   Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in   materials produced.   Embrace different points of view and welcome opposing and conflicting ideas.   Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                     Mandatory skill sets-    Fuels & resources     Qualifications-    grad/post grad

column2: W      HAT WE LOOK FOR WHILE RECRUITING:              Whether it is a consulting expert, a research analyst, a finance prodigy or an investment banker, we seek to hire the best across the globe and provide them with a unique global ecosystem of learning, experience and expertise. Our teams are diverse, entrepreneurial and fun, comprising millennial's and seasoned experts, who are passionate about changing the landscape of social change. The ability to serve the next 3 billion is an opportunity of immense promise, and we look at those who are entrepreneurial in their mind-set, sharp in their thinking and bring in deep sector expertise to deliver compelling work globally. Undertake detailed financial and technical analysis where required including complete business planning and financial modelling              Deliver client presentations and manage client expectations              Engage with senior experts internally and externally on aspects related to the project              Support business development through proposal development and new clients reach out              Straddle multiple day to day roles that include project delivery, client relationship management, team building and mentor-ship, and business development;              Be part of the team that contributes towards developing the domestic and global strategy for the consulting practice at Intellecap.              Undertake relevant national and international field travel and exposure as and when required.

column2: This is an opportunity to be a part of Bain's AMS CoE, based out of Gurugram office, and specifically support Bain Global case teams on live cases, client development and proposal support       AMS CoE consists of 70+ team members, organized into ~18 teams, working across various sectors such as real estate/construction, heavy machinery, commercial aviation, logistics & transport       You will work on AMS projects and get exposed to various BCN products ranging from go-to-market strategies, industry analysis, and competitive benchmarking to excel models, survey analysis, and ad-hoc studies, on live client cases as well as for business/client development       An Associate works as a team member/contributor on BCN cases, driving the analysis on complex cases with some direction from a Project Leader and occasionally leading simple cases independently     In addition, associates help mentor and coach analysts providing feedback     The expectation is to eventually provide significant direction and support to resolve complex issues and effectively manage client and team meetings     As an Associate, the individual would mostly be working on    the following AMS sub-sectors real estate/construction, heavy machinery, commercial aviation, logistics & transport             About you             Work experience range in case highest qualification is undergraduate studies - 2-5 years    in consulting/ research/ analytics, with hands on experience in AMS sector (Construction, Real Estate, Manufacturing, Airlines, ports, logistics, factory set-up etc). Prior experience/ familiarity with AMS sector is a must.       Work experience range in case highest qualification is postgraduate studies - 0-3 years    in consulting/ research/ analytics, with hands on experience in AMS sector (Construction, Real Estate, Manufacturing, Airlines, ports, logistics, factory set-up etc). Prior experience/ familiarity with AMS sector is a must.     Incumbent should be a graduate or post-graduate from top-tier institute or have pursued a commerce/statistical/analytical course from a tier 1 university.     Candidate should be currently working in strategy consulting/research-oriented set-up and possess acumen to solve open-ended problems     Proficient in research and analysis, as well as able to provide solid business judgment to derive answers in situations where data is not easily available or explicitly published     Able to interface with primary client contact (Bain case teams from global offices)     Play a bigger role on long-term AMS cases typically 3-12 months duration, with frequent interactions with the case team (and potentially end clients whenever opportunity persists)     Display independent secondary research, analytical, and story lining skills     Think out-of-the-box to solve for niche case scenarios, through baselining and benchmarking of global best practices     Open to intermittent travel to other Bain offices/client locations on live cases           What you'll do           May have first-level team management responsibility, which involves allocating and reviewing work to a small team of analysts and conducting performance / feedback discussions     Provide content thought leadership & may manage simple cases independently     Candidate should be currently working in strategy consulting/research-oriented set-up and possess acumen to solve open-ended problems     Proficient in research and analysis, as well as able to provide solid business judgment to derive answers in situations where data is not easily available or explicitly published     Able to interface with primary client contact (Bain case teams from ME offices)     May have first-level team management responsibility, which involves allocating and reviewing work to a small team of analysts and conducting performance / feedback discussions     Provide content thought leadership & may manage simple cases independently

column1: Sr Associate - Consulting - Technology Strategy & Transformation
column2: A career in our Advisory Acceleration Centre is the natural extension of PwCs leading class global delivery capabilities. We provide premium, cost effective, high quality services that support process quality and delivery capability in support for client engagements                   Job Description              ?     As part of the TS&T team, the incumbent will play an important role in supporting PwC Canada engagements from India in driving the companys strategic and operational initiatives, implementing innovative solutions, measuring results early and often, and ensuring performance meets the desired targets.         Job responsibilities mainly include activities driven towards delivering results - conduct analyses and develop insights, prepare excel models, analyze large sets of data, support project lead, work directly with project teams and facilitate meetings to enable decision making, organize and prepare recommendations to address client problems, and participate actively in new business development, thought leadership and firm building activities.             ?         Knowledge preferred         ?     PwCs Technology Strategy & Transformation practice is aimed at providing client solutions that are directly related to the CIO/CTO,      managing/transforming     business functions and providing diligence with respect to technologies involved.      ?       Our range of services includes delivery of client engagement in the following areas:               Technology Strategy:    IT Strategy, M&A / Due Diligence, Application Portfolio Assessments, Systems Advisory, Business Continuity & Risk, Business case development, Emerging technology and innovation       IT function transformation:    IT operating model transformation and organization design, IT process and service management, DevOps and IT transformation, Technology governance, IT expert services, Agile transformation       Strategic IT sourcing:    Strategic sourcing, Request-for-proposal support (design and build), Contract review and optimization, Contract negotiation services, Feasibility assessment, Transition support services       Cloud Advisory and Finops    - Cloud Strategy & Readiness, Cloud Governance, FinOps Strategy & Operating Model, Cloud Cost Optimisation       Architecture    &    Integration    - Technology effectiveness, Enterprise architecture, Digital business architecture, Solution architecture, Integration services       Technology project delivery -    Project and program management (PPM) services, Product management, Agile Services, Application development, Innovate and prototype technology solutions, PPM assessment services, Testing as a Service                   Skills & Responsibilities                 Conduct thorough research and analysis of client organizations, including their industry, competitors, and market trends.          Collaborate with client teams to identify challenges, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement.         Facilitate workshops, interviews, and meetings with key stakeholders to gather information and insights.         Support RFP and Proposal response building. Work on Firm Reinvestment activities and support Thought Leadership.         Analyze data and financial reports to assess performance, identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations.          Develop comprehensive action plans, strategies, and roadmaps to address client challenges and achieve their goals.          Present findings, recommendations, and implementation plans to clients in a clear and persuasive manner.         Provide guidance and support during the implementation phase, working closely with client teams to ensure successful execution.          Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions, adjusting as necessary.                  Requirements             3 to 5+ years of experience in management consulting, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects.          Strong analytical skills and ability to effectively interpret and analyze complex data sets.          Excellent problem-solving abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a strategic mindset.          Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.          Proficiency in using various analytical tools and software, such as Excel, PowerPoint, and data visualization tools.          Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. - Demonstrated experience developing winning proposals          Ability to develop the approach, pricing structure, and team for a proposal                                     Qualifications           bachelors or masters degree - Technology and Management (Business Administration) specialization preferred     3 - 7 years relevant experience preferably in Digital, Technology and Cloud in consulting or technology function of industries         Certifications relevant to any of the following or more areas -         Cloud-based service providers like AWS, Microsoft, GCP, etc     TOGAF, ITIL 4, COBIT certifications

column2: Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of. Your Role and Responsibilities As an Software Engineer, you would be responsible for deploying IBM Middleware suite of products with flair knowledge on Scripting. Be a trusted Advisor of the Customer on Integration space. Work for smooth delivery of assigned projects Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic development environment Be a hands-on person and deliver.  Will be involved in product installation/ configurations, troubleshooting (performance, 3rd party integrations, security) Based on customer requirements, deliver the deployment. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Must have minimum 5 - 12 year's experience with IBM EAI tools like IBM API Connect, IBM Datapower and IBM MQ Good expertise in enterprise integration, API management and middleware technologies. Design and Development of API Proxies with Policy configurations on IBM API Connect Hands experience on IBM API connect with knowledge on Developer Portal, API Manager Developer toolkit Strong knowledge of API design principles, RESTful architecture, and microservices. Experience with API security, authentication, and authorization protocols. Hands-on experience in DevOps and CI/CD tools such as Git, Jenkins, Nexus etc Good experience in Java/J2EE, Microservices architecture, APIs (REST and GraphQL) Must have experience in OAuth2.0, SAML, JWT and SSO Must have experience in IBM API Management for implementing REST API, SOAP APIs, Plans, Security Policies. Good expertise in enterprise integration, API management and middleware technologies. Install, configure, and maintain IBM DataPower appliances and API Connect infrastructure in a clustered environment, ensuring high availability and load balancing for APIs.  Collaborate with development teams to design and implement API policies and security configurations on DataPower and API Connect to protect sensitive data and enforce API governance.  Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues related to DataPower, API Connect, API traffic, and overall system health.  Manage and maintain SSL certificates, cryptographic objects, and security configurations on DataPower devices and API Connect gateway.  Work closely with network and security teams to integrate DataPower appliances and API Connect into the existing infrastructure and enforce security best practices.  Assist in capacity planning and scalability efforts to accommodate future API growth and traffic demands. Develop and maintain documentation related to DataPower configurations, API Connect configurations, API policies, and troubleshooting procedures. Good monitoring, logging and troubleshooting skills Good knowledge in Docker and Kubernetes container orchestration systems Experienced with IBM Data Power development activities like service design, creation, AAA creation. XSLT, XQuery, Gateway Script, XSD, SOAP web services, REST services, SAML. Should have experience on Crypto profiles and debugging skills. Strong knowledge in XML, WSDL, XSLT, JSON, XML Schema, and XPATH Should have experience in Gateway script and XSLTs. Should have good knowledge in Node JS and framework available for it (such as Express, etc depending on your technology stack) Experience in Administration and configuration management tasks Good Troubleshooting skills and monitoring activities Strong knowledge in DP Firmware Upgrades Should have knowledge on installation and networking concepts. Creating Users, domains, access restrictions Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Hands-on Experience in AAA (authentication, authorization, auditing) and  Customization of AAA Policy Hands-on Experience in SSL/TLS Proxy configuration and certificate management. Good knowledge of SOA, SOAP, REST, WSDL, XSD, XML, XSLT, XPATH and JSON Error Handling & Logging in DataPower Good to have knowledge on CP4I,APIC,ACE,AWS. Experience on connecting the applications with the other application using different protocols( HTTPS, FTP, MQ, TCP etc.) Experience in IIB/ACE administration on windows and UNIX systems.  Troubleshooting and Managing IBM WebSphere channels, listeners, intercommunications (TCP/IP) and triggering. Experience in writing reusable, testable, and efficient code Experience in writing Automation scripts Experience in creating backend connections with different platforms MQs, Stored procedures, Data tables, APIC. Experience with cloud service providers like AWS/Azure/GCP Familiarity with API security standards such as OAuth, JWT, SSL, and API key management.  Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Shell, Python) to automate tasks and implement monitoring solutions. Strong communication, written, and presentation skills Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills

column2: As a MarTech Associate, you will work across core Marketing and GTM systems to support and enhance the operations of our campaigns, their performance data and technologies     The role requires a solid working understanding of the general MarTech landscape, marketing automation platforms (MAP), CRM and database health     You will work cross-functionally to ensure smooth operations of our campaigns and marketing data infrastructure - supporting campaign builds and workflows in our MAP, creating campaign efficiencies, monitoring/maintaining system performance and supporting MarTech planning initiatives     The ideal candidate is tech-forward, detail-oriented, focused on scale/speed to market, has strong communication skills and a passion for MarTech         Responsibilities          Understands and can operate various functions within a MAP (eg, Marketo, Pardot, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, etc) - eg, managing workflows and automations, editing lead generation forms, partnering with Marketing Data Analyst for campaign member/performance reporting, supporting the creation of emails and landing pages, managing email and landing page templates and general system maintenance)     Monitors email campaign mailbox replies, routing inquiries to internal channels and maintaining mailbox organization     Runs monthly system QA tests to ensure our MAP lead generation engine, integrations and data flows are functioning as expected     Partners with Marketing Data Analyst for delivery of monthly and ad hoc email campaign performance reporting     Executes list imports from industry events and other partnership-based initiatives     Creates and maintains Salesforce campaigns which are infrastructurally critical for campaign performance, channel performance and ROI reporting     Investigates and reports on data privacy requests across GTM systems in partnership with the Privacy team in response to data subject access requests     Supports the planning of annual and ongoing MarTech growth or consolidation efforts     Supports the implementation and troubleshooting of MarTech systems     Helps maintain, organize and streamline tech and marketing automation documentation     Optimizes and supports project management systems and processes     Owns admin functions of various key systems, including system maintenance, cleanup and managing user onboarding/offboarding         Qualifications          2+ years of proven experience working in a marketing automation platform (eg, Marketo, Pardot, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, etc)     Familiarity with CRM systems (eg, Salesforce) - understanding of Salesforce Campaigns, Leads, Contacts and Accounts General understanding of the MarTech landscape and usage of tools (eg, Demandbase, Drift, Postal.io, etc)      Experience with running QA/test scripts HTML knowledge is a plus

column2: If you are ready to take your career to the next level, then we are here to help. We have multiple positions available for the following profiles: Consultant Technology Management: 3 Positions. Consultant Program Management: 3 Positions. Location: Bhopal, MP If you have a passion for serving on state government projects and are seeking a role in the Bhopal location, then this position is perfect for you. Requirement: Profile 1: Consultant Technology Management:  Looking for someone who involved in Technical Projects, holds technical degree, aware about latest technology, holds some technical certifications. Profile 2: Consultant Program Management:  We are looking for someone who has good experience in stakeholder Management, RFP, DPR, FRS, BID Management, Agile and someone who holds management certification.  Role & responsibilities   We offer a maximum increase of up to 20% on your current Cost to Company (CTC). For individuals falling under Category B, the upper limit is 10 LPA, while for Category A, it is 15 LPA. For instance, if your current CTC stands at 12 LPA, we can provide a hike of up to 20%, resulting in 14.40 LPA. However, if your current CTC is 13 LPA, the maximum hike permissible is 15 LPA, as per the 20% limit.

column1: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Sales Cloud)- Techno-Functional Role
column2: IT Sr. Business Systems Analyst Salesforce Sales Cloud (CRM Centric) The IT organization is seeking to add a Senior Salesforce Business Systems Analyst with specific focus on Salesforce Sales Cloud. The ideal candidate has extensive experience and can act as a subject matter expert in customer relationship management (CRM) processes and the Salesforce platform. The business analyst must balance strong written and verbal communication skills will system expertise and best practices. As key member of the dedicated CRM IT Service Team, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will have the following responsibilities: Understanding the goals of business & then provide support to the existing Salesforce solutions within Sales Cloud (and related solutions), working on production support, trouble-shooting issues, and implementing small to medium enhancements. Contribute to large strategic projects and/or new solutions in this space.  Build and maintain relationships with corporate and regional stakeholders, analyzing and understanding business requirements, business processes, functional requirements, cross-functional needs, and system capabilities.  Employ a variety of approaches to collecting and documenting business and functional requirements. Such techniques may include, but not limited to, leading workshops, writing use cases, creating context diagrams, and performing stakeholder analysis.  Design and implement Salesforce-based solutions to meet or exceed business requirements, adhering to best practices and solutions design standards, with an emphasis on maximizing out-of-the-box solutions. Help the business to solve moderately complex issues by taking a new perspective on existing solutions.  Collaborate regularly with other Business Systems Analysts and Application Solution Consultants on cross-functional requests and solutions.  Collaborate regularly with Technical leads, Salesforce developers, and integration developers on functional requirements to implement custom extensions or application integrations to satisfy business requirements when needed.  Act as a resource for colleagues with less experience, support Project Managers with planning, execution and management of project deliverables and risks.  Work closely with QA analysts and may perform functional, regression, unit, functional and user acceptance testing.  Qualifications REQUIREMENTS: Minimum of 5 years of experience in business systems analysis 3+ years of global CRM experience, including understanding of the following processes: marketing, lead generation and management, accounts, contacts, opportunity management, territory management, forecasting, sales processes, etc. 3+ years of Salesforce.com experience including Sales Cloud. Salesforce Administrator certification required Strong understanding of Salesforce capabilities, best practices and limitations and the ability to clearly communicate those to key stakeholders  Strong organizational, interpersonal and analytical skills with attention to detail Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Capable of relaying technical information to Business Stakeholders and business information to technical teams. Ability to accept and manage changing priorities and address issues quickly and professionally Ability to accept and manage changing priorities and address issues quickly and professionally. Familiarity with any of the following applications is a plus: Eloqua, Gainsight, Dun & Bradstreet, Qualtrics. Salesforce Advanced Administrator certification is a plus Experience with ServiceNow or a similar ITSM tool is a plus
column11: Sales Cloud, Salesforce Sales Cloud, marketing, Eloqua, forecasting, lead generation, Salesforce.com, Gainsight, territory management, sales, CRM

column2: The Marketing Manager will play a crucial role in driving brand awareness, lead generation, and market growth for our business. As a growth oriented start-up, we prefer candidates willing to roll up their sleeves and get things done, and are comfortable working in ambiguous environments.         Role & responsibilities       Analyze and understand business processes and requirements of the organization.   Implement, configure, and customize ERPNext modules to fit the organization s needs.   Provide guidance on best practices and optimal use of ERPNext.   Conduct training sessions for users and prepare user documentation.   Coordinate with technical teams for integration with existing systems and data migration.   Troubleshoot and resolve issues in the ERPNext system.   Keep abreast of updates and new features in ERPNext and advise on adoption.   Manage ERPNext projects, ensuring timely delivery within budget. Teamwork and Leadership The ERPNext consultant is responsible for coordinating the needs of each of the company s divisions. They must be able to lead meetings to collect information and then unite these disparate visions into a cohesive whole for the entire company,   Communication and Presentation Skills The ERPNext Consultant is responsible for presenting a full plan to management, as well as for teaching the ins and outs of the upgraded system to employees. Minimum of 3 years of experience working with ERPNext, including implementation, customization, and support.   Proficiency in ERPNext configuration, setup, and administration.   Strong understanding of ERPNext architecture, modules, and features.   Experience with ERPNext scripting (Python), customization, and development tools. column2: WJCF is      seeking     a highly motivated individual         with outstanding credentials and      demonstrated     analytical abilities to work closely with Ministry of Health & Family Welfare/NCVBDC in coordination with WJCF. Associate will         help NCVBDC in      accelerating      malaria     elimination     in India. The Associate will          provide technical support in strengthening program management including M&E to      facilitate     data backed decision making, strengthening governance and      capacity     building initiatives. They will also support data collation, analysis and visualization and identification of innovative approaches/technologies to support the elimination goals.                               Responsibilities:                     Under the guidance of the Manager     and NCVBDC     , co-create and      monitor     the strategic direction of the      Malaria     programme and ensure consistent improvements in      strengthening management and governance, service delivery, supply chain, and other elimination aspects.                     Work      closely      with      Malaria      team      to     align priorities and develop and manage relationships     with diverse stakeholders.                      Analyse the trends and discern patterns from available data      for data backed decision      making                     Under guidance of NCVBDC, review existing M&E systems, vector surveillance tools and indicators in use by the government and relevant partners;      identify     sources of data available and flow of information.      Identify     key bottlenecks towards achievement of National and state      goals for overall management of      Malaria                         Lead the development of programme communication approach and collaterals for external stakeholders such as government, donor, and partners for furthering programmatic and organizational outreach      objectives     .                     Undertake periodic visits to States/UTs and districts to      identify     challenges and     address gaps.                     Support in design and implementation of innovative approaches and recommendations to address key surveillance gaps in the programs at the national and state level.                         Support the Manager to develop evidence-informed new initiatives for hypothesis testing, demonstrations, and scale within the ambit of existing grants and for actively writing and converting proposals for new      grants                     Undertake      desk research and interviews to understand the      current status     of the      Malaria prevention and control activities      that may include     (indicative list     )     :                     GIS mapping capabilities for entomological surveillance                      Mapping of data portals and use of routine data across different health systems                      Status of cross border malaria interventions and intersectoral coordination mechanisms for malaria                     Communicate effectively across a matrixed organization and coordinate                      Other responsibilities as      needed                     Qualifications                 Qualifications:                         Bachelor s degree in public health, epidemiology, economics,      sociology     or other relevant fields with 4 years of professional experience; or master s degree with     mimimum     2 years of professional experience.                     Professional experience in a demanding private sector environment, such as strategy consulting, market research, or public sector advisory.                     Previous     experience with M&E, Data analytics and dashboard development for multilateral funded projects.                     High levels     of      proficiency     in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.                     Ability to work independently in remote and unstructured settings, to work closely within and across other teams and to adapt to new environments and challenges.                     Excellent written and oral communication skills in English, problem-solving and strong organizational      abilities     and detail-oriented approach.                     Willingness to travel      frequently     (~30-50% time) and extensively across the region, and to other trans-continental meetings.                             Skills & Traits:                          Knowledge of malaria, NTDs or other global infectious disease priorities                     Experience living or working in resource-limited      countries                     Experience working and communicating with government officials and multilateral      organizations                     Experience working remotely with a decentralized/remote      team                         Experience or knowledge of health finance, public finance, or finance for      development

column2: A career in our Government and Public Sector Transformation Management practice, within General Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities     We work with some of the world's largest and most complex companies to understand their unique business issues and opportunities in an ever changing environment     We help create sustainable change by stimulating innovation, unlocking data possibilities, navigating risk and regulatory complexity, optimising deals, and aligning costs with business strategy to create a competitive advantage     In joining, you'll help federal, state and local government clients solve complex business issues and manage jurisdiction related risk.     You'll help our clients assess their operational and security and data management strategies so they can continue to operate more efficiently and effectively, both today and tomorrow.          Expertise Keywords:    Urban Mobility Expert, Traffic & Transport Expert, Enterprise System Architect.       The open position is for a candidate who desires to work with government clients and bring about a change in society.      A successful candidate will be expected to work pro-actively and effectively on multiple client engagements over the period of time and take ownership of the entire project delivery he/she entrusted with.         Broad Role / Responsibilities         Formulating comprehensive strategies for urban mobility projects encompassing transport, traffic management, parking solutions, and last-mile connectivity.     Understanding on the overall urban mobility market in India for various solution and vendor eco-system knowledge.     Preparation of the technical blueprints, functional and technical benchmarks of the mobility solutions.      Expertise in understanding of the DPR, RFP, Concept Note and technical assessment documents for the mobility solutions.     Conducting feasibility studies to assess the viability of proposed mobility projects.     Engaging with various stakeholders including government bodies, STUs, PTOs and ULBs.     Identifying and integrating cutting-edge technologies for enhancing urban mobility.         Broad Experience & Expertise Requirements         Analyse current transportation systems and devise strategies to improve efficiency, accessibility, and sustainability. This involves studying traffic patterns, public transportation usage, and future growth projections.     Understanding of conceptualization and design traffic management systems to minimize congestion and improve traffic flow.     Assess parking needs and develop solutions to address parking shortages and improve utilization.     Knowledge of last-mile connectivity options, such as bike-sharing programs, micro-mobility solutions, and shuttle services.     Understanding on Integrating various urban mobility solutions into broader smart city initiatives.     Identify and recommend innovative technologies to enhance urban mobility.     Specific Past Work Experience Requirements     Experience in working with Urban Mobility projects (Transport, Traffic, Parking, Last Mile etc), Smart Cities, Smart Tourism etc     Must experience to work with Government & Public Sector in India.         Educational Qualifications         Bachelors degree in engineering / Architecture / Transport Planning / Urban Planning etc     Masters is an advantage.     Knowledge of EA -Enterprise Architecture, IT Operating Models is added advantage.     Certifications (in software)     Proficient in MS-Office (Presentations, Word, Excel deliverables)     Personality traits (a must)     Strong communications skills, both written and verbal     Ability to handle complex assignment independently.     Ability to work with ambiguity. Taking a systematic, structured view of situations.     Ability to interact with client (senior government officials)     Demonstrating willingness to get hands dirty and developing a problem-solving attitude     Strong personal and professional presence and self-confidence, capable of working effectively with senior team as well as all other levels.       Mandatory skill sets   - Experience in working with Urban Mobility projects (Transport, Traffic, Parking, Last Mile etc), Smart Cities, Smart Tourism etc Proficient in MS-Office (Presentations, Word, Excel deliverables        Preferred skill sets    - Urban Mobility Expert, Traffic & Transport Expert, Enterprise System Architect.        Qualifications    - Bachelors degree in Engineering/ Architecture/ Planning etc Masters is advantage.

column2: Corporate Solution Architect  Description: The HR Corporate Solution Architect plays a key role toward helping Accenture employees unleash their potential, build extraordinary careers, and lead themselves and their clients to high performance. The Corporate Solution Architect is a steward of our HR vision and is passionate around partnering with CoE counterparts to design and deliver solutions that delight our employees and bring this vision to life.  This role will be aligned with the HR Technology team. HR Technology is responsible for supporting existing and implementing new technology to support Accenture employees globally. This team is responsible for supporting HR technology across multiple functional areas including Core HR, Recruiting, Onboarding, Internal Transitions, Talent Supply Chain, Learning, Credentials LOA, Exit, Alumni etc. Most of these areas are now supported on our Workday and ServiceNow applications which form the backbone of our global technology enablement. The HR Corporate Solution Architect provides leadership, vision, and oversight to their own team as well as indirect teams (Shared Services, Development/Delivery teams) and drives business requirements / user stories, and solution blueprints; provides oversight for implementation/delivery activities and ultimately, ensures business value is realized for our technology initiatives.  may also be responsible for effective operations management of our technology solutions.  applies knowledge of various global entities, geographies, business practices and workforces, as well as Accenture's strategic business objectives, to successfully execute key responsibilities. participate in audits related to security, compliance, and internal controls. support deployment of releases, including content configuration and readiness, user acceptance test activities, and enablement activities to industrialize new functionality. Responsibilities: HR IT Strategy: Understand both our HR and Accenture technology strategies. Business Acumen Develop and maintain knowledge of HR processes and understanding of related processes to encourage alignment with other organization, process, and technology areas. Develop and maintain an understanding of industry and technology trends related to area of responsibility. Stakeholder Management Build and manage stakeholder relationships across business, process, and technology teams, driving coordination, communication. Uses simple and easy-to-understand frameworks and formats (e.g., PowerPoint slides, reports, talking points) to present information and ideas. Technology Design, Development & Operations Capture business, functional, and application requirements, support prioritizing them by cost and opportunity within Accenture's overall business strategy, to maintain overall alignment to other initiatives / integration with other enterprise systems. Analyze as-is and to-be processes to define system/technology requirements. Understand and translate customer needs into business and technology solutions. Oversee smooth flow of production operations to meet cost, quality, controls, and delivery targets. Effectively balance initiative release components (e.g., scope, quality, schedule) to ensure successful release of new capabilities. Qualification Preferred Skills Business Process Design Enterprise Architecture Strategy Business Process Modeling Solution Architecture Stakeholder Management Workday HCM This job description reflects management's assignment of essential functions. It does not prescribe or restrict responsibilities that may be assigned.
